Meet Hawa. She is 32 years old and comes from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with five children.  In 2005, Hawa established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requires a loan to purchase more coconut oil and waxed cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut oil and waxed cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is 33 years old and married, with five children. 

She would like to start a small business, producing and selling "elei lavalava," printed textiles, in her community. 

In order to do this, Matauaina needs a loan to buy fabric color paint, stencils, brushes, materials, and elei carved designs. 

She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially. She is a new member of SPBD.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paint, stencils, brushes, materials and elei carved designs

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is 43 years old and married with one child.
 
She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ela needs a loan to buy a rake, a garden hose, fertilizer, a pickaxe and a wheelbarrow for her garden.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Ela will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a rake, a garden hose, fertilizer, a pickaxe and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tausili

texts.en:
Tausili is 56 years old and married with eight children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.Tausili needs a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack sprayer, knives, a spade and a file. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.Tausili will use the profits from her sales to extend her business"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a knapsack sprayer, knives, a spade and a file

loans.name: Ela

texts.en: Ela is a 42-years-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Ela needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, plastic bags and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help with her children's education. Ela has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, plastic bags and a cooler.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the group Fe y Accion 1 (Faith and Action). The members of this group, like many others, run their businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes, and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. 

Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. Margarita operates a Fantasia, a small business where she sells miscellaneous products. She has been in business for over seven years, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it. She is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc., to sell. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Margarita is very happy for your support and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!!!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, women's accessories, underwear, clothes, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Yostus

texts.en: Yostus used a previous loan to pay school fees for his children.  He is a fifty-year-old married man and lives with his twelve children in Kasese, Uganda.  The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and set up a number of income generating activities.  He has been in the hardware business for ten years and also farms as an additional income source. His hardware business is located on a busy street, thus he attracts many customers.  His business plan is to open up another hardware shop in the nearby town.  Yostus intends to use the loan to pay school fees and to sell doors and bars.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to sell doors and bars for his hardware business.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, desea invertir más en el inventario de su negocio, en está ocasión comprara frijoles, maíz, aceite, carnes, golosinas entre otros productos para surtir la tienda y tener ingredientes para elaborar la comida de su comedor. 
Con la inversión anterior ella mejoro las condiciones de su local, adquirió mesas, la tienda estaba muy surtida para que sus clientes siguieran siendo fieles y también estuvieran satisfechos. su economía mejoro mucho pues pudo cancelar sin ningún problema el préstamo.
texts.en: Ana would like to invest more in inventory for her business.  This time she will buy beans, corn, oil, meat and candy, among other things, to supply her store and to have ingredients to make food for her restaurant.  With the previous loan she improved her business premises and the store was well stocked, so that her customers remained loyal and were satisfied.  Her financial situation improved greatly, and she was able to repay the loan without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, oil, meat, and candy, among other things.

loans.name: Veronica Alejandra

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 28 años de edad, quien nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias más reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador, ella actualmente está casada tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en otro cantón por lo que casi no se ven ellos viven en casa de su madre en un departamento que se los entregó,  el obstáculo más grande que ha tenido es la falta de oportunidades para trabajar, razón por la cual Verónica se ha visto en la obligación de buscar otras fuentes de ingresos y con los consejos de familiares y amigos se dedica a la venta de ropa en forma ambulante, además ella trabaja como profesora en una escuela en el sector rural de la ciudad de Latacunga.
Su sueño y anhelo es poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación y un mejor estilo de vida, para que a futuro no les pueda faltar nada.  Necesita el crédito para invertir en mercadería nueva por temporada navideña y así sus ganancias se incrementarán.
Verónica y su esposo quieren  extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Verónica is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She was born in the city of Latacunga in the Province of Cotopaxi, whose people have a great reputation across Ecuador for their strong work ethic. Verónica's husband works in another canton, so they rarely see each other, but Verónica's mother gave the couple an apartment in her home and the family lives there. 

The lack of opportunity to work is the greatest obstacle Verónica has faced, so she's had to seek other sources of income. She works as a teacher in a rural school in Latacunga, but also started a business selling clothes at street markets on the advice of family members and friends. 

Verónica's ambition and her wish is to provide an education and a better standard of living for her children so they won't want for anything in the future. She needs a loan to invest in new merchandise for the Christmas season and thus increase her income.  

Verónica and her husband would like to express their sincere thanks and best wishes to the Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation] in Ecuador and to Kiva for making their professional and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Asmenvi 1  & 2 Group

texts.en:
Fabia is the coordinator of her group "Asmenvi 1 & 2 ". This group is located in the rural area surrounding Samana where the economy is dominated by the tourist industry. The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and many other miscellaneous products in their “batey” community (generally made up of poor, migrant workers) and other nearby communities. 

Four years ago, Fabia started her business from her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her food stall which sells Empanadas (filled fried dough).  She will buy flour, meat, cooking oil, vegetables, and other goods. She makes round dough, fills it with different ingredients, fries it and then sells the Empanadas in her food stall at night. 

Fabia says her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business and vary her product with different ingredients. She thanks the Lord for these loans which have enabled her to increase her economic activities. One of her favorite things to do is to serve. Fabia is excited about her third loan and will  use the profits to improve her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Perladiza

texts.en: Perladiza, married with four children, helps her husband earn an income with his buy and sell business. She has been buying coconuts in their community and reselling them in volume for eight years, earning well for the family's daily living. She joined GDMPC and requested a loan to buy additional coconut to resell. She always finds ways to augment their situation. Perladiza's determination to improve the general living situation of the entire family is her strength during the ups and downs of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts to resell

loans.name: Malaetele

texts.en: Malaetele is 27 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a sewing business venture. She has three years of experience in this line of business. Malaetele needs a loan to buy threads, material, an overlock machine (serger), and dozens of buttons. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and help with her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy threads, material, a serger and dozen of buttons.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla helps her husband operate their transportation service to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years, offering motorcycle rental and transportation. She has joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy new tires for the motorcycle. Her only child is still studying and her profit is being used to support his education. Myla wants to have better living conditions for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Paquita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc.

Paquita has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Paquita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase ingredients like sugar, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rowena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc., for her general store business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 42 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for two years and also earns income from selling vegetables.

Pinky is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 62-years-old and married with six children.

Maura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Maura has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Maura aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Jose Rumaldo

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que necesita más capital ya que con el crédito anterior obtuvo unas buenas ganancias y con el nuevo podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas, semilla y un cerdo, para mejorar su negocio, con el crédito anterior obtuvo mejores cosechas y ganancias.
Su condición económica es mucho mejor que antes, su negocio ha crecido, sus granos son de mayor calidad.
texts.en: José is a farmer who needs more capital, as with his previous loan he was able to make higher profits, and with this new loan he can buy fertilizer, compost, herbicides, seeds, and a pig to improve his business. With his previous loan, José obtained better harvests and earnings. His economic situation is much better than before, his business has grown, and his grain crops are of a higher quality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, herbicide, seeds, and a pig.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 29 years old and lives in Caldwell. She’s married and her husband works with a construction company and they have 3 children that are attending school and living at home. For the past 7 years, she has been selling slippers, body cream, spray, and powder. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, body cream, spray, and powder for her business. She plans to send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, body cream, spray, and powder for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, doughnut, and many items for her business

loans.name: Okesa

texts.en:
Okesa is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Okesa has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and boots for her plantation. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Okesa hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and boots

loans.name: Sayda Melania

texts.es:
Sayda de 33 años de edad, casada,  con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, crema, Sayda es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable, con alta calidad moral. Y sobre todos con mucha ganas de superación personal. Ya que su mayor  sueño es poder llegar a forma a su hijo en un profesional. Lamentablemente ella no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, sal, tiste, fósforos, aceite. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Sayda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sayda is 33 years old, married, and has one child who is a minor. She is originally from El Sauce, located in the north of the country. El Sauce is known as an area that produces milk, cream, and cuajada cheese. Sayda is an enterprising, hard-working and responsible woman, with moral integrity, and above all, a desire to excel. Her biggest dream is to give her child the education for a professional career. Unfortunately, she was not able to study due to a lack of economic resources. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to succeed, she has a small grocery store that sells items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, drinks, matches, and oil, in small quantities. She runs this business for 12 hours daily, selling her products so that she might obtain higher earnings in a not-too-distant future. 

Sayda is grateful for the support that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua,so that people can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in her business capital and stock her business with products to sell such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, drinks, matches, and oil.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is a 50-year-old man.  He lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His youngest daughter studies at a secondary school. His older daughter is a university student in Ulaanbaatar city. He has been running a taxi service business for years in town with his motorcycle. He used to work for an army unit and as a gardener and veterinarian. He has built a regular client base.  

He was previously able to replace some of his motorcycle's spare parts and make it more suitable for his transportation service business. He is now planning to prepare for a cold winter and is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to purchase an efficient stove and insulation material for his Ger, a traditional nomadic tent house. Ulambayar is a hardworking, responsible and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to purchase an efficient stove and insulation material for his Ger, a traditional nomadic tent house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a cafeteria business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional coffee, sugar, milk, etc. for her cafeteria business.
Merciditha has been in this business for two years. Merciditha earns more income from selling vegetables.

Merciditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coffee, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 63 years old and widowed, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 56 years old and married, with three children.  

Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie is 52 years old and married, with seven children.

Ramie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Ramie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years, and she also earns  income from pre-paid mobile load.

Ramie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc

loans.name: Marie Kris

texts.en: Marie Kris dreamed to be a teacher in the future. She studied BEED - General Education at Western Mindanao State University. Her father is a farmer, while her mother is a businesswoman. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for the first semester tuition fees. Currently, this semester, she borrowed another loan to pay the school fees. She is hopeful to finish her studies and be able to help her parents to augment their living and to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay the school fees

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry improved his farm as an aid to his wife's income from employment as a teacher. 

He has been at his farm for five years, proving that he was able to provide the family expenses. His three children are still studying and being prepared for college education. 

Cherry borrowed from GDMPC  microcredit to buy fertilizer and seedlings to improve his farm. 

Cherry wants to improve the general living of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur with a sugarcane farm business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for her sugarcane farm business.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store and farming sugarcane. 

Grace is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her food-vending business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through no fewer than 24 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Concepcion is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for the cultivation of land.

Concepcion has been farming sugarcane for eight years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the cultivation of land

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elvera works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elvera is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Elvera has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leolenita

texts.en:
Leolenita is 56 years old and married, with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries for the harvest of sugarcane and preparation for land cultivation.

Leolenita has been farming sugarcane for 20 years. She also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for harvesting sugarcane and land cultivation

loans.name: Emir

texts.en:
Emir is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is his story.

“The best way to make a career is to work out a plan. I always dreamt about good career and to become a businessman or manager of a big company. But I realized that it is not easy to become successful businessman. It is necessary to have personal qualities, such as hard workmanship, courage, leadership, ability to work in a team, make decision in difficult situations, be responsible for ones acts. I am confident that the knowledge and skills gained in AUCA will be invaluable contribution to make my dream happen. I was studying at local school in Balykchy. Later I applied and was accepted to the Turkish lyceum in Karakol, where i have been studying for the past five years. I had a good opportunity to improve my language skills and deepen my knowledge of math and learn teamwork skills. I am interested and reading about various large famous companies, about how they were created, how they reached success, I admire those people who could open and develop own business in our unstable political situation in the country. Our country needs young professional creative and honest people, who will be able to improve everything: economics, business, agriculture and all other aspects. To my opinion this university can give me a high qualified knowledge. AUCA has good reputation that provides high quality education. AUCA gives another unique opportunity to its students, which is loan. The loan is given to all students applying for financial aid, which is given my Kiva. I am very happy that AUCA cooperates with such a great organization that gives us – students such opportunity.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en:
Nuufou is 33 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nuufou needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weed spray. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Nuufou will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weed spray.

loans.name: Mu

texts.en:
Mu is a 44-year-old married woman with five children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro root, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Mu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, spade, and axe. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Mu hopes to provide good support to her family and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, spade, and axe

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. She previously accessed a PHP 50,000 loan that she used to buy additional stocks of merchandise like jackets, blouses, shirts, and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of jackets, blouses, shirts, and other products. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of jackets, blouses, shirts, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yabes

texts.en: Yabes is a 29 year old man who recently married Oktavia, a 29 year old lady. Yabes is a building contractor who partnered with the local government to build public facilities such as schools and health services. He is currently involved in a project to build a community health center in one of the sub districts. He needs additional capital to do so. Therefore, he is requesting an individual loan of 7,500,000 IDR from TLM. The loan will be spent on building materials to support the project. He is hoping that the project will be successful so that he will be able to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a computer shop and photocopier business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and pig fattening. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts, papers, toner ink, etc., for her computer shop and photocopier business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, papers, toner ink, etc.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a 27 year old married woman with two children.

Flor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Flor has previously borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Flor plans to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for sugarcane harvesting.

Wilma has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for sugarcane harvesting

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a widow parent of four children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a sugarcane-farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Violeta is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to pay for laborers for the harvest of sugarcane for her sugarcane-farming business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers for the harvest of sugarcane.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is married and has five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Bakyt

texts.en:
Bakyt is a first-year student of AUCA in the department of Economics. Here is his story.

“I decided to enroll [in] the American University of Central Asia, department of Economics and have several reasons for this. First, economics is the most important science for the countries, particularly for work of banks. Their prosperity and success lies in their activity in economy. So in my opinion the knowledge of economics is required. Economists are demanded almost everywhere. For example, in government sectors, banking and financial activity of companies and industries. I am interested in economics and I want to build my career in the field of economics. This department will give me ability to take basic knowledge of this science and will help me to be successful in future because of the high level of education of the education. So this program will give me a lot of possibilities. In general AUCA is a perfect place to start a successful career, and can be long to describe the benefits of this university. I am very proud to be part of this great team. 

"Amongst all other great opportunities that AUCA provides its students, another opportunity is that [it] gives loans to them. I would like to apply for [a] Kiva loan, as my family is not able to cover my tuition fully, so it will help me to solve my financial difficulties.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Tusipo

texts.en:
Tusipo is 33 years old and married with four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Tusipo needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, spade, and weed spray. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Tusipo will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, spade, and weed spray

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a 25-year-old mother who aims to improve her small variety store to increase her income. She plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital. Therefore,  she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods, breads, beverages, eggs, noodles and canned goods to sell. Michelle hopes that the amount of loan she requested will enable her to improve the business she manages. In this way, she can sustain her family's basic commodities someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods, breads, beverages, eggs, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita's first business involvement is in direct selling, particularly cosmetic products, ready-to-wear clothes and shoes. Gained income from this business serves as revolving capital for her additional business of a sari-sari [convenience] store with Karinderia. At this time, she offers groceries and cooked food for meals. Teresita wanted to complete the grocery items she offers. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 38,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy diapers, babies' milk powder, coffee, sugar, noodles, toothpaste and raw ingredients used in cooking food for meals. She hopes that her business will continue to grow smoothly for her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy diapers, babies' milk powder, coffee, sugar, noodles, toothpaste and raw ingredients used in cooking food for meals.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en: Elpedio lives in Inroad, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He is 20 years old and studies at Western Mindanao State University where he is an electrical technology student. His parents grow and sell rice to earn a living. His previous loan from GDMPC was used to pay for the school tuition fee for the first semester. Currently, he borrowed another loan for the second semester school fees. Looking forward to a better future, Elpedio prays for a chance to obtain a good profession for a better living.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with five children. She owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) to earn a living, and she's been in this business for six years. In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC. Her previous loan, used to buy raw materials, was successfully repaid.

Aside from this, she has engaged in a retail business, selling groceries .   Currently, she has borrowed a new loan to buy additional stocks like dried fish and vegetables for sale. In the future, Merlyn wants to make improvements to her house and expand/improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like dried fish and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analita is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries in harvesting sugarcane and for land preparation.

Analita has been farming sugarcane for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for harvesting and land preparation

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Luz is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Benita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Benita has been raising livestock for nine years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase addititional livestock to raise

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a house-rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP [Philippines pesos] through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to pay for the salaries of carpenters for an extension of her boardinghouse.

Emelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Emelia's business profile for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay the salaries of carpenters for an extension of her boardinghouse.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, es casada, tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, hace ya 15 años que instalo una tienda en su casa y ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, trabaja a tiempo completo, su facilidad es que la tienda esta´ ubicada en su residencia. 
Ella opta por capital para comprar jabón, aceite, maíz, frijoles y otros productos que le ayuden a satisfacer a sus clientes, tendrá un inventario mas surtido, generara más ingresos con los poco a poco ampliara más la tienda.
Sueña con tener el capital suficiente para ofrecer a sus hijos una educación superior, alimentación sana, un negocio más rentable y seguir apoyando a su esposo en sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is married, is 28 years old,  and lives with her husband and their two children. Because of the need to support her husband with household expenses, she set up a store in their home 15 years ago, where she offers basic goods. The benefit of this is that the store is located in her home.

She has decided to get a loan to buy soap, oil, maize, beans and other products to meet her customers' needs. She will have a better stocked inventory, and will generate higher profits with which, little by little, she will expand the shop. 

She dreams of having enough capital to offer her children the chance to have a higher education, a healthy diet, and a more profitable business, and to continue supporting her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, maize, beans and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase eggplants, carrots, cabbages, green/red bell peppers, string beans, squash, and bitter gourds to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Emma from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. For the past 10 years, Emma has had a retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard working and desires to improve her standard of living.

Emma requires a loan in order to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, Emma plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is married with nine children. He makes pump boats for a living. He has been doing this for nine years, earning well for his daily living. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase raw materials for boat-making. He is hopeful to improve his business and be able to send his children to school and finish a course for their own future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for boat-making

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar's age is 49, and he is a hard working farmer. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell. He also hires laborers who help him in planting rice seedlings. He has been in this business for over 20 years, and he is very proud to sustain his family through his income.

Gaspar wants to keep his crops healthy for better growth, but he has insufficient funds, that's why he is asking for a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Gaspar hopes to keep achieving better harvest and gain more profits for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is a 45-year-old woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Aliitasi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a spade, and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Aliitasi hopes to extend her business

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a spade, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn owned and operates a buy-and-sell business, selling rice and corn in bulk. She has been doing this for five years, and she earns well for her living. To improve her business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more rice and corn to resell.

She wants to improve her business and own a milling business to be able to sustain a better future for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more rice and corn to resell.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Delma works very hard to provide for them.

Delma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soaps, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Delma has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soaps, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gina has been in this business for 8 years. Gina earns more income from a general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Sao from Jui, east of Freetown. She is single with 2 children. For the past 10 years, Sao has run a clothing business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income for her living expenses. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Sao requires a loan to purchase wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her quality of life and increase her business. In the future, Sao plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es: Luisa es una joven diseñadora de modas de tan solo 24 años de edad, quien por falta de oportunidades laborales no pudo continuar ejerciendo su carrera. Hace algún tiempo se le presentó la oportunidad de ir a una conferencia de productos nutricionales de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial y, allí vio en esta actividad una oportunidad de negocio rentable ya que en el mundo actual las personas cuidan más su salud, por verse y sentirse bien; por ello decidió dedicarse a vender estos productos con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo mucho conocimiento y su clientela fue aumentando, lo que le permitió abrir su propio club de nutrición, el cual ha dado muy buenos resultados y ha tenido una excelente aceptación en el municipio donde reside, por ser el único que allí existe. Adicionalmente cuenta con el apoyo de su familia quienes consumen los productos y además los comercializan. Su espíritu emprendedor, empuje y dinamismo la motivan a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (batidos, malteadas, vitaminas, suplementos dietarios, entre otros) y abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de productos y las necesidades de su clientela; esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y de los ingresos que éstas le generan, además podrá ser mucho más competitiva en el mercado, haciendo de su negocio una actividad más rentable. Luisa sueña con darle continuidad a su actividad, seguir prestando sus servicios de asesoría en nutrición y guiar a aquellos clientes que desean iniciar su propio club nutricional, lo que le permitirá percibir ingresos adicionales para mejorar su calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luisa is a young fashion designer of only 24 years of age who for want of employment opportunities couldn't continue working in her field. Some time ago she had the opportunity to attend a conference for a well known international nutritional product company. She saw the opportunity for a profitable business as people today pay more attention to their health to look and feel better. So she decided to sell these goods with the intention of generating income to help support her household.

Little by little she has gained knowledge and her clientele has grown which allowed her to open her own nutrition club. Which has had good results and has been well received in the municipality where she lives as it is the only one there. Also she can count on her family who use the products and also sells them. 

Her entrepreneurial spirit, drive and energy have motivated her to request a loan with which she will buy stock wholesale (shakes, malts, vitamins, dietary supplements, etc.) and supply her business with enough to satisfy the demand for products and necessities of her customers. This will bring about an increase in sales and the profit that that generates. Also she can be more competitive in the market, making her business more profitable. 

Luisa dreams of sustaining her business, and to continue to offer her services as a nutritional adviser which will permit her to receive more revenue to improve her quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (shakes, malts, vitamins, dietary supplements, etc.)

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 50 years old and a resident living in Kampong Cham province. She has been married for years and unfortunately, doesn't have any children. As well as local villagers, Sophy is in the business of rice husbandry, from which she is able to generate an income of USD 4.80 per day. Though it is a very hard work, Sophy loves doing the business as it’s the sole source of income for her family.

Currently, Sophy’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of 600 US Dollars to build a household latrine.

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, which encouraged her to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando, ha aprovechado mucho el capital que se le dio antes, pues amplio su negocio adquiriendo pollos, para criarlos y luego venderlos, En está ocasión necesita un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de concentrado, vacunas y pollos de un día de nacidos, con esto el estará preparado para la demanda de estas épocas de graduaciones escolares y la de fin de año.
Fernando se mantiene trabajando en su negocio sin ningún problema, ha mejorado un poco su economía familiar, su familia se encuentra muy saludables.
texts.en: Fernando has benefited greatly from the capital he has received previously, which allowed him to grow his business of buying chickens to raise and sell. This time, he needs a new loan to invest in the purchase of chicken feed, vaccinations, and chicks. With these purchases he'll prepare for the demand that comes this time of year, with school graduations and the end of the year. Fernando supports himself by working at his business with no problem. He has improved his family's economic situation a little and his family is in good health.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of chicken feed, vaccination, and chicks

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, está empezando a preparar la tierra para su próxima siembra y necesita comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, para tener una producción mayor y de mucha calidad. Con el crédito anterior sembró sin ningún problema, ya que tenía todo lo necesario para la siembra, obtuvo mejores ingresos, cancelo las deuda de su crédito y mejora las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Sigue luchando por aumentar su área de siembra, en su familia todos están con mejores condiciones de vida como alimentación más adecuada y salud.
texts.en: Luis is starting to prepare the fields for the coming planting. He needs to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to harvest a larger and high quality crop. With the last loan he planted without any problems as he had everything he needed for the seeding. He made more money, paid off his loan and improved the living conditions of his family. He continues to struggle to increase the area he plants. Everyone in his family is in good condition with good food and health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Fredis Orlando

texts.es:
Fredis, decidió solicitar un nuevo crédito porque se siente muy satisfecho con la atención que la institución le da, además necesita capital para comprar repuestos para el molino de nixtamal que posee, es su fuente de ingresos y con el da un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con el crédito anterior le dio mantenimiento a su molino, mejoro sus ingresos y sus clientes están más satisfechos.
Sigue apoyando a su familia en todo lo que necesita, dándoles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar para ser profesionales y atendiendo el negocio para que se mantenga activo.
texts.en:
Fredis decided to request another loan because he is very satisfied with the institution's service. Also, he needs capital to buy replacement parts for his nixtamal grinder. This is his source of income and helps him provide good service to his customers. With his previous loan, he performed maintenance on his grinder. This improved his income and his customers are very satisfied.

He keeps providing his family with everything they need, giving his children the opportunity to go to school so they can become professionals. He also attends to his business to stay active.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his nixtamal grinder.

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Eugenio, es un agricultor que se dispone a sembrar granos básicos (maíz, maicillo y frijoles), para continuar generando los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Comprará insecticidas, plaguicidas, abono y semillas, con todo lo necesario para su siembra tendrá mejores ganancias como las obtuvo con el crédito anterior.
Su economía ha mejorado mucho por lo que él pudo cancelar sin ningún problema sus deudas, su producción es mayor y el producto es de mejor calidad.
texts.en: Eugenio is a farmer who decided to plant basic grains (corn, millet and beans) to continue to generate the income necessary to support his household. He will buy insecticide, pest-control, fertilizer and seeds. These are necessary for his crops to be more profitable, the same as what happened with the last loan. His financial situation improved considerably so he could pay off his loan with no problems. His production was higher and the product was of better quality.

loans.use: to buy insecticides,pest controls, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: José Josué

texts.es:
José es un joven de 24 años de edad, soltero, vive en el Caserío Monte Mercedes, Sololá.
El es una persona con muchos deseos de salir adelante; actualmente se dedica al comercio; el compra y vende verdura (frijol, zanahoria entre otros) esta actividad la realiza en el mercado del municipio de Sololá, lo que le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos personales como los de su familia.
Con mucha alegría el manifiesta que tiene 5 años de realizar esta actividad que además de generarle ingresos le sirve para estar en contacto con su comunidad y con la naturaleza.
El necesita más capital de trabajo para compra de verdura y por eso está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00.
El sueño más importante de José es remodelar su casa y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
José is a 24 year old, single, young man.  He lives in the Caserío Monte Mercedes, Sololá.  He is a person with a lot of desire to get ahead.  

He currently buys and sells vegetables (beans and carrots, among others).  He conducts this business activity at the Sololá municipal market.  This generates for him the income needed to cover his personal expenses like those of his family.

He very happily says that he has been engaged in this business activity for five years.  In addition to generating income for him, it serves for him to be in contact with his community and with nature.

He needs more working capital to buy vegetables.  That is why he is requesting a loan for 7,000 GTQ.

José’s most important dream is to remodel his house.  This way he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Elodia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con un hijo en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella cuenta con mucha experiencia en confección, lleva 15 años de tener su taller de costura, donde hace vestidos para niñas. El taller lo tiene en su casa y tiene buena clientela. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 lempiras para comprar telas e hilos y abastecerse de materiales para la confección de vestidos. Su propósito es incrementar las ventas y mejorar el nivel de vida con su familia. Tiene pensado desarrollar mas el negocio y contratar personas que le ayuden para sacar mayor producción.
texts.en: María is 62 years old, a single mother, and lives in the city of San Pedro Sula. She has a great deal of experience in dressmaking, as she has had a dressmaking workshop for 15 years, where she makes girls' dresses. Her workshop is located in her home and she has a good customer base. She has requested a second loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras to buy fabric and threads and stock up on materials to make dresses. Her aim is to increase her sales and improve her family's living standard. She is thinking of further developing her business and hiring people to help her to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads to make girls' dresses.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, vive con sus compañera de vida y sus hijos, el no posee otro tipo de ayuda en los gastos familiares más que los ingresos obtenidos de la siembra de granos básicos. Está actividad lo aprendió de su familia y es una labor que desempeña de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. Su mayor ventaja es que siembra en terreno propio. 
Con el crédito comprara abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y pagara la mano de obra, espera generar una buena cosecha, granos de calidad, mejorar su economía.
Su sueño es tener una vivienda de otro tipo de material, como paredes de ladrillo, un piso de sementó, un techo seguro, para que su familia este mejor.
texts.en:
José is in a relationship.  He lives with his life partner and their children.  He does not have any other type of help with the family expenses than the income from growing basic grains.

He learned this business activity from his family.  He works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  His biggest advantage is that he grows on his own land.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor.  He hopes to generate a good harvest, quality grains, and to improve his finances.

His dream is to finish his home with another type of material like brick walls, a cement floor, and a reliable roof, which will be better for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona de 38 años de edad, tiene una linda familia integrada por 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 son hombres y 3 mujeres, de todos ellos dos están estudiando; estudian por las mañanas y ayudan a su papa por las tardes. Don Alberto y sus hijos viven actualmente en Caserío Chuacruz, Aldea Pujujil, Sololá.
El es de oficio agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de arveja y papa; esto lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive, además del cultivo también comercializa su producto en el mercado del municipio de Sololá; esta actividad le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos debido a la buena rentabilidad que tiene. Con estos ingresos el cubre los gastos familiares tanto de alimentación como educación de sus hijos 
Tiene 12 años de realizar esta actividad lo cual tiene aceptación y demanda de los vecinos de su comunidad
El necesita comprar más papa y por ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00.
El sueño más importante de Alberto es apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y ayudarlos a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Alberto is 38 years old and has a beautiful family with 5 children - 2 boys and 3 girls, two of which are in school. They study in the mornings and help their father in the afternoons. Alberto and his children currently live in Caserio Chuacruz, Aldea Pujujil, Solola. He is a farmer, growing peas and potatoes. He farms in the community where he lives, and he also sells his crops at the market in the town of Solola. These sales account for most of his income, thanks to the the good profitability he achieves. With this income, he covers his household expenses, including food costs and expenses for his children's education. 

He has been farming for 12 years, and enjoys acceptance and demand for his produce from his neighbors in his community. He needs to buy more potatoes, and so he is seeking a loan of 2,000 Guatemalan Quetzals [GTQ]. Alberto's greatest dream is to support his children in their education and to help them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción 41  años  de edad,   vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace  06  años al negocio de venta de golosinas, pan y tamales su venta es de forma ambulante.
Doña Asunción sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario visita y que le visitan en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora que desea salir adelante y es un ejemplo de trabajo y de superación para los vecinos y demás personas. 
Doña Asunción está solicitando el préstamo para compra de papas, plátanos, cebollas,  harina, maíz, leña y gallinas. Con el apoyo del préstamo  pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es su séptimo  préstamo que solicita.
Doña Asunción su sueño es mejor su  negocio y construir un día su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Asunción is  41  years old. She lives with her husband and three children in her house. For the past 6 years she has been selling sweets, bread and tamales. She sells door-to-door. Asunción's clients are her friends and people who she visits daily or who visit her at her home. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. Her neighbors and others regard her as a good example of a worker and someone who will get ahead.

Asunción has requested a loan to buy potatoes, cooking bananas, onion, flour, corn, wood and chickens. With the help of this loan she wants to improve her business and in the end improve her quality of life. She is very pleased to continue working with Prisma. This is her 7th loan. Asunción's dream is to improve her business and construct her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2013.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cooking bananas, onion, flour, corn, wood and meat for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is 42 years old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. In 2000, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and cola nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and cola nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Bove

texts.en: Bove is a single entrepreneur from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur who runs a piggery business raising and selling pigs in town. He has been in this business for three years and earns well for his needs. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed. He is hoping to gain more profit to renovate a new pig shelter. Bove wants to improve the general living of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro manages his own rice farming business to earn a living. He is married with three children and he's earning well from farming for their daily living. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer. Alejandro wants to improve his farm in order to gain more profit for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 42, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family. Thuy earns money through running a food stall to sell breakfast to people in her community. 

She would like to get a loan to buy better food to satisfy her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy better food to serve her customers.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor  Ismael de  47 años de edad, tiene  tres  hijo que dependen de él, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, ubicada en una  comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Ismael y se dedica desde hace 8 años  al negocio de la venta y elaboración de ladríllalos y tejas para construir casas, tiene cuatro ayudantes a los cuales les da empleo de forma temporal y permanente.
 Don Ismael es una persona seria y trabajadora tiene su propósito de mantener su taller funcionando para así generar más empleos en la zona. Sus clientes son las personas que construyen casas y personas que se encuentran en el extranjero y mandan remesas  a sus familiares para que compren estos productos para construir sus propias casas.
 Don Ismael está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de leña y tierra que son la materia prima para elaborar sus ladrillos, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Don Ismael su sueño es tener un buen taller para emplear más personas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Ismael is 47 years old. He has three sons who are dependent on him. He lives with his children in his own house located in the San Lorenzo Valley in the south of Honduras. For the past 8 years Ismael's business has been the manufacture and sale of bricks and roof tiles used in residential construction. He has four assistants he employs on both a temporary and a permanent basis. Ismael is a serious and hard-working person who has the intention of keeping his workshop running and create more employment in his area. His clients are people who build houses and people who are outside the country who send money to their families to buy these materials to build their own homes.

Ismael is requesting a loan to buy wood and soil which are the raw materials he needs to make bricks. He is very pleased to continue working with Prisma. Ismael's dream is to have a good workshop to employ more people.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.

loans.use: to buy wood and soil for his business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is originally from Prey Veng Province. She is 39 years old and married with four children. One of her children is married while the other three are single and still depend on her income. Pov and her husband raise their family by farming rice on their own land, which was inherited by parents on both sides after their marriage.

Currently, Pov’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 750 US dollars to build a household latrine and buy accessories for it. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she has been encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past nine years, Judith has been working hard to manage her produce business selling produce and flour. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to boost her stock, and will help Judith to generate greater profits to be able to pay her children's school fees. Judith hopes that in the future, she will be able to complete her commercial house. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Judith who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more produce and flour to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, 63, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Artuo, an electrician, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nelia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Nelia hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Crisanta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Creslie

texts.en:
Creslie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from boarding house rental.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices and vegetables like onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, etc. to sell for her buy-and-sell spices and vegetables business.

Creslie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and vegetables like onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  señora María del Carmen   de 61  años de edad es casada vive con su esposo, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia.
Doña María del Carmen   se dedica desde hace 07  años  a la venta de ropa nueva, frescos, churros, paletas y cualquier venta que le genere ingresos, su actividad la realiza en su casa y también de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, personas que la conocen y los que pasan por su casa.
Doña María del Carmen   es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de vestidos, faldas, camisas, blusas, etc. está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y con las ganancias que obtenga por sus ventas espera mejorar su calidad de vida ya que tiene varios proyectos para este año, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y vender bastante ropa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora Maria del Carmen, who is 61 years old, is married and lives with her husband. She has no dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras, and she has her own house.

Doña Maria del Carmen has worked for 7 years selling new clothing, soft drinks, chips, ice pops, and whatever else she can sell to generate income. She works from her home and also as a street vendor. Her customers are her friends, people who know her, and those who pass by her house. 

Doña Maria del Carmen is a hard-working woman with the desire to advance. She is applying for the loan to purchase dresses, skirts, shirts, blouses, etc. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. With the earnings that she obtains through her sales, she hopes to improve her quality of life, since she has a number of projects for this year. Her dream is to improve her business and sell quite a lot of clothing.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2013.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, shirts, blouses, etc., for her business

loans.name: Marvin Noe

texts.es:
El señor Marvin  Noé de 30 años de edad es padre de dos  hijos, vive con su  esposa y se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta y de carro, vende lubricantes, llantas usadas y también repara las mismas.
Don Marvin es una persona joven trabajadora que desea sacar adelante a su familia y gracias al apoyo de estos préstamo el está creciendo en su negocio.
Don Marvin está solicitando el préstamo para compra de llantas usadas, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma para su negocio y cuenta que le va muy bien,  su sueño es mejorar cada día mas su taller y vender otros productos que se vende también en la zona. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Marvin Noé, 30, is the father of two children. He lives with his wife and for the past three years, he has made a living by selling tires for bicycles and cars, selling lubricants and used tires, and repairing tires. Marvin is a hard-working person who wants to move his family forward. Thanks to the support of these loans, he is growing his business.

Marvin is requesting a loan to buy used tires. This is the fourth loan he is requesting from Prisma for his business and he says things are going very well. His dream is to improve his workshop every day and sell other products that are also sold in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to buy used tires for his business.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with five children. The oldest is 9, while the youngest is 4. Her husband worked as a fisherman to support their family. 

She is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells various fresh fish to help augment the income of their household. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials, such as styrofoam (for fish storage), fishing materials like fish net, and fuel for the boat. 

In the future, Marijen hopes to expand her business and increase her business’ profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as styrofoam (for fish storage), fishing materials like fish net, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed an 38,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and their personal, household, and business expenditures. Aside from her variety store, she also sells rice for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 52 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Cynthia has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from boarding house rental. Cynthia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more livestock to sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Vilfido

texts.es: Vilfido, tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma.
