Vilfido trabajo por varios años en actividades de jardinería y hace 1 año se dedica a la elaboración y venta de encurtido de vegetales, semillas de ayote, cacahuate, condimentos. Este producto lo envasa en bolsas y vende por ristras de manera ambulante. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de encurtido como ser cebolla, chile jalapeño, zanahoria, colorante etc. y cacahuates, semillas de ayote, pimienta, cominos y otros, para vender en ristras. Con este préstamo va incrementar el inventario y  aumentar las ventas. Su meta es conseguir un mejor local para su negocio.
texts.en: Vilifido, 48, lives in a civil union with his wife. They have two children and live in the town of Choloma. Vilfido has worked in gardening for several years. For the past year, he has made a living preparing and selling pickled vegetables, pumpkin seeds, peanuts, and condiments. He sells these products in bags and on strings by traveling around.He has requested a loan of 8,000 HNL, which he will invest in buying raw materials to pickle onions, jalapeños, and carrots, and to get food coloring, peanuts, pumpkin seeds, cumin and other products to sell on string. With this loan, he will increase his inventory and make more sales. His goal is to find a better location for his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as onions, jalapeños, carrots, food coloring, peanuts, pumpkin seeds, peppers, and cumin to sell in

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José del Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Yamango, ubicado en Morropon, esta comunidad se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, son una familia que se esfuerza en su labor su esposa le apoya en esta actividad desde hace 4 años, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar arreglos navideños, luces, corbatitas y adornos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José del Carmen is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Yamango district, located in Morropon. This community is known for its forests of mesquite. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

He sells clothing and footwear. His business is located in his home. They are a hard-working family. His wife has been helping him in this business for four years. José has applied for a loan of 1500 PEN to purchase Christmas decorations, lights, bows, and ornaments to offer his customers and in this way generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations, lights, bows, and ornaments for his business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle service business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle service business. Gemma has been in this business for 3 years and earns more income from boarding house rental. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, tiene 54 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 4 años que tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece  productos de la canasta básica como ser harinas, refrescos, dulces, churros, pan, queso, mantequilla, pastas, frijoles, maíz, arroz, etc. Este negocio cuenta con clientes fijos y es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. El prestamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de mas productos alimenticios para surtir el negocio, como ser manteca, huevos, pan, granos básicos, azúcar, harina, café, sal, churros y otros, con el propósito de aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta es que su negocio crezca y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 54 years old and is in a common-law relationship with her husband, with whom she has three children. She lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She has had her own small general store business for four years, where she offers basic household products such as flours, soft drinks, candy, snacks, bread, cheese, butter, pasta, beans, corn, rice, etc. 

This business has regular customers and is her family's source of income. The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras. She is going to use it to buy more grocery products for stocking her store; such as lard, eggs, bread, staple grains, sugar, flour, coffee, salt, snacks and other items, to increase sales and revenue. Her goal is to see her business grow and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for stocking her store, such as lard, eggs, bread, staple grains, sugar, flour, coffee, salt, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Matea

texts.es:
Matea es una señora de 43 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a su familia en el Caserío El Oratorio, departamento de Sololá
Ella se dedica al cultivo de cebolla, esta actividad la heredó de sus padres desde su niñez y actualmente es el medio por el cual ella obtiene los ingresos para el sustento de su familia y de ella misma. Cuenta que a pesar de su edad no tiene ninguna dificultad para realizar esta actividad tan importante para ella.
Lleva 12 años realizando esta labor; además de esta actividad ella también es jornalera y es contratada por otros vecinos de la comunidad que se dedican a actividades similares y esto le genera ingresos extras.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de semilla de cebolla y fertilizante para la siembra y el mantenimiento.
Matea sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para tener una vida más digna tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Matea is 43 years old, single, and lives with her family in the village of El Oratorio in Sololá department. She makes a living growing onions, an activity she inherited from her parents from a young age, and today, this is the way she makes an income to support herself and her family.

She says that despite her age, she has no difficulty in carrying out this activity, which is so important to her.  She has done this job for 12 years. Se also works as a labourer and is hired by other neighbours in the community who make a living in similar activities, which generates extra income.

She is requesting a loan of Q 2,000.00 to buy onion seeds to sew and fertiliser for maintenance. Matea's dream is to improve her living conditions so that she and her family can live a more dignified life.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds to sew and fertiliser  for maintenance.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: El grupo “HACIENDA CHACRASANA” se encuentra conformada por 09 mujeres trabajadoras y empeñosas quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Martha tiene 50 años es conviviente con un hijos educando en la universidad. Hace muchos años trabaja en el cuidado del adulto mayor. Años atrás se dedica a dar servicios de domestica. El préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de las pensiones universitarias de su hijo de 17 años. Su mayor deseo es visitar a su hija quien se encuentra en el extranjero hace más de 30 años. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Martha es la tercera persona parada viste chompa negra y polo azul.
texts.en:
The "Hacienda Chacrasana" group is made up of nine hard-working and dedicated women who engage in various retail activities. Martha is 50 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son attending university. She has been working for many years looking after an older person. Years ago she worked as a housekeeper.  

She will use the loan to pay for university fees for her 17-year-old son. Her greatest desire is to visit her daughter who has been out of the country for more than 30 years. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Martha is the third person standing, wearing a black sweater and blue T-shirt.

loans.use: To pay her son's university fees.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica al cultivo de limón ácido, frutales, comercio de los mismos, a dos horas de la ciudad e Jaen, que pertenece a Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Es muy conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza, brindando el servicio de carpintería con la ayuda de sus hijos, tiene su pequeño taller en su domicilio, ocasionalmente se desempeña como albañil.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compra de madera y herramientas de trabajo y de esta manera generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Germán is 64 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the San Felipe district, where the residents work in growing lemons and other fruits and selling them. It is located two hours from the city of Jaen, which is in the Cajamarca district, on the north coast of Peru.

He is well known in the area for the work that he does, offering carpentry services with the help of his children. He has a little workshop in his home, and he occasionally works as a mason.

He has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase wood and work tools and in this way generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for work

loans.name: Ginez

texts.es:
Ginez tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral, son una familia emprendedora que realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados, y una segunda parte para compra de aves de corral y de esta manera ofrecerlo en el mercado de la zona, lo que le generaran mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ginez is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their children in Oyotún district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants grow rice, yuca, corn and raise livestock. 

He and his family raise and sell farm animals. They are an enterprising family that has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years.  He has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the purchase of balanced feed, and a second part to buy poultry so that he can sell it in the area's market. This  will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for fattening his small animals, and buy poultry for his business.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Señora Isidora de 55  años de edad es casada vive con su pareja en su casa ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la comercialización de golosinas de manera ambulante, vende cuajada y leña en su casa.
Doña Isidora está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, papas, plátanos, yuca, carnes y leche, con sus ganancia desea comprar más productos para comercializar y seguir progresando y mejorando su calidad de vida. 
Doña Isidora es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora que día con día se prepara para salir a vender sus productos que a diario prepara para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Isidora su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y terminar de reparar su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora Isidora is 55  years old and is married. She lives with her partner in a house located in the village of San Lorenzo, in a valley in the south of Honduras. For a long time, she has made a living selling sweets in the street, and sells curd cheese and firewood in her home.

Isidora is requesting the loan to buy maize, firewood, potatoes, plantain, manioc, meet and milk. With her earnings, she wants to buy more products to sell and continue progressing and improving her quality of life.

Isidora is a very, hard-working humble person who gets ready every day and goes out to sell her products which she prepares fresh each day  to offer to her customers. Isidora's dream is to boost her earnings and finish repairing her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2013.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, potatoes, plantain, manioc, meat and milk for her business.

loans.name: Paul Henry

texts.es:
Paul Henry tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, para abastecer a la empresa azucarera de la zona, arroz, maíz, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la venta y crianza de animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar patos y cuyes y una segunda parte para construir los corrales para una mejor producción y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Paul Henry is 49 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Cayalti. Its inhabitants engage in sugar cane cultivation that supplies the sugar mill business in the area. They also grow rice, corn and raise cattle and trade. The place is two hous from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

With his wife’s help, they make a living raising and selling small animals. Their business is situated behind  their house. Paul Henry has requested a loan of  S/. 1,000 to purchase ducks and guinea pigs, with a part set aside to build corrals to increase production.  Thus he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and guinea pigs and to build corrals for his small animals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es: Tiburcio, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. El se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de jornal pero hace 5 años decidió por su propio negocio a la elaboración y venta de comidas como ser pastelitos de pollo, baleadas, refrescos y jugos naturales. La comida la vende de forma ambulante utilizando una bicicleta para distribuir los alimentos. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de insumo como frutas, azúcar, bolsas, carnes, harinas, condimentos, manteca y otros para la elaboración de comida y jugos para vender. Su meta es aumentar los ingresos y asi mejorar su nivel de vida y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Tiburcio is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida. He works as a day laborer, but five years ago he decided to have his own business, preparing and selling foods such as chicken empanadas, baleadas (a Honduran dish consisting of a folded wheat tortilla filled with beans and other ingredients), soft drinks, and natural juices. He sells the food as a street vendor, using a bicycle to distribute it. The loan that he has applied for is for 5000 lempiras, and he is going to use it to purchase supplies such as fruit, sugar, bags, meats, flour, condiments, lard, and other items to prepare the food and juices to sell. His goal is to increase his income and thus improve his level of living and give a better education to his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruits, sugar, bags, meats, flour, condiments, lard, and other items to make food and juice to sell

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en la zona rural de Santa Rita a 15 minutos de Oyotun , su población se dedica a labores agrícolas y ganaderas, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Su esposa le apoya en la crianza y venta de aves de corral, son una familia emprendedora tiene la oportunidad de vender sus animales en la feria que se realizara fin de año en una comunidad aledaña, por lo que Abelardo ha solicitado un préstamo de de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte cuyes y patos para ofrecerlos en la ocasión y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Abelardo is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their children in the rural area of Santa Rita, 15 minutes from Oyotún, located in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants farm and raise livestock.

His wife helps him raise and sell poultry. They are enterprising family and have the opportunity to sell their animals at the market which takes place at the end of the year in a neighboring community.  So Abelardo has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed, and the second part to buy guinea pigs and ducks to sell at that time, and this way generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed as well as ducks and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
Balvina tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora desde hace un año su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, nos explica que realiza esta labor para contribuir con su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de insumos para aumentar la producción de chicha de jora y cerveza y una segunda parte para arreglo de local y asi tener un lugar agradable donde acoger a sus clientes, aumentando la demanda, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Balvina is 49 years old. She lives with her husband in the district of La Matanza. The people there engage in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. The district is located in Morropon province, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

For the past year, she has made a living selling beer and “chicha de jora,” a home brewed fermented corn drink. Her business is located in her home. She explains that she does this work in order to contribute, along with her husband, to household expenses. She has requested a loan of S/. 4,000 to stock her business by buying supplies to increase production of “chicha de jora” and beer. Another part of the loan will used to upgrade her shop so that she can have a more pleasant place to serve her customers. This will increase demand and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare "chicha de jora.".

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 73 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, ganadería y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con el apoyo de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores en el mercado de la zona, son reconocidos por la labor que realiza.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar pavos, patos, cerdos y una segunda parte para alimentos balanceados para los mismos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vidal is 73 years old and lives with his wife in Cayalti district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants grow sugar cane and  rice, raise livestock and engage in commerce.

With his wife's help, he raises small animals and sells them in the area's market. They are well known for the work they do. He has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy turkeys, ducks, pigs, and  a second part to buy balanced feed for them. This way he can have better production to offer his customers.

loans.use: To buy turkeys, pigs and balanced feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de Cayalti, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y arroz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, pavos, gallinas y patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles construir corrales para una granja de cerdos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel  is 62 years old and lives with his wife in the rural area of Cayalti, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants raise sugar cane and rice, and engage in commerce and livestock-raising.

He and his wife raise and sell small animals such as pigs, turkeys, chickens and ducks. His business is located in the area behind his home.

He has requested a loan of 3500 nuevos soles to build animal enclosures for keeping pigs. This is in order to have better production to offer his customers, and generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: To build animal enclosures for keeping pigs.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 48 years old and divorced, with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has run a food stall in front of her house for the past five years. She sells breads with pork cut into small pieces and sticky rice. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by buying better quality food at a wholesale price to serve her customers at a competitive price. 

She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to serve her customers

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie is married with four children, two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother).  She has a business of selling fish and has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. 

She generates additional income from a retail shop. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler of fish and also to educate her children up to university. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they give loans without collateral. She resides in the family business, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Egidius

texts.en:
Egidius is 35 years old and married to Florida, who is 41. They are blessed with three children: Felicia, 14, 2nd grade of junior high school; Nini, 9, 4th grade of elementary school; and Laura, 5. 

Together with his wife, Egidius runs a business selling cakes, such as fried bananas, pastry, and fried tofu. They have been running the business for three  years now. Egidius is grateful for the income generated, which enables him to cover their family's daily needs.

Egidius is thinking of opening a kiosk business.  Therefore he submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 7,000,000. He would like to spend the loan to buy items like soap, coffee, sugar, and rice. He hopes that the business will enable him to repay the loan to TLM

loans.use: to buy items like soap, coffee, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Marina Del Cisne

texts.es:
Marina del Cisne tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y frutales, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida en el medio, por su labor de venta de yogures, quesos, quesillos, es así como contribuye con su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ha solicitado un préstamo e 2 00 nuevos soles para capital de trabajo compra de leche en tarro, azúcar, cultivo, cuajos, envases de plásticos para el yogurt, y de esta manera seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marina del Cisne is 37 years old. She lives together with her husband in Cayalti district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here grow sugarcane, rice and fruit.

She is known in the area for her work selling yogurt and cheese. In this way she can contribute along with her husband to the household expenses. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN for working capital to buy canned milk, sugar, culture, rennet and plastic containers for yogurt. Then she can continue to offer her products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy canned milk, sugar, culture, rennet and plastic containers to sell yogurt.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married with 12 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luisa is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Luisa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.  Ma. Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is a 52-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in the Telavi district of east Georgia. Zakaria works as a welder and gets 250-300 GEL per month. His wife trades perfumes from home. 

As Zakaria does not have a stable income, he decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,500 to purchase a car. When the car is purchased, he will buy a stock of household goods and transport it by his car to sell. He plans to go to Turkey to buy goods, as there are cheap prices there for household goods. 

Zakaria is very motivated to start his own business and make a profit to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and begin a trading business

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 43 years old and married, with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income selling noodles with beef. 

Thao started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying new furniture to better serve customers at her stall. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for her food stall

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc, 53, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family by running a food stall in front of their house. They started this business ten years ago.

He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of soft drinks to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of soft drinks to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Lailah

texts.en:
Lailah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has no children who are currently in school. For the past ten years, Lailah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food and cold drinks. 

To help expand her business, Lailah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her assets in the business through buying more stock of soft drinks and food items, and will help Lailah to generate greater profits and construct more rental houses. Lailah hopes that in the future she will be able to to transform her restaurant into a hotel. 

Lailah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lailah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to expand her assets in the business through buying more stock of soft drinks and food items

loans.name: Allam

texts.en:
Allam is a 22-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a simple house in the village. Allam's father was working as an employee, and now he is retired because of his age and health conditions. Allam is a student in a local university where he studies engineering. He loves his studies and he would like to finish his BA degree with very high grades.

Allam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Allam will be able to do his homework and reports by using special programs for engineering. This will help him to finish his studies with very good grades.

Allam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Amoni

texts.en:
Amoni is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Amoni has been working hard to manage his business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Amoni has requested a loan of 3,000,0000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase  his capital base through adding inventory to his timber store, and will help Amoni to generate greater profits. The profits will enable him to finish his residential houses. Amoni hopes that in the future he will be able to to acquire a timber-milling machine to ease his work. 

Amoni is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amoni who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To increase his capital base through adding inventory to his timber store

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 57 years of age and a resident from the district of Bakan, Pursat province. She has a life partner with a humble man, who is in the same business as she is, farming rice. This couple has been blessed with seven children, three of whom are married and live independently. 

Now San has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to build a safe latrine to improve the family's sanitation and personal hygiene, as she doesn't have one yet in her home. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she was encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment. 

San’s dream is to expand her farming business, which will be sustainable and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine to improve her family's sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en:
Norlina is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Yermias, a 32-year-old man. They have been blessed with a daughter named Joany, age 3.

Norlina initiated a honey-selling business two years ago. She usually gets the honey from surrounding villages. Twice a week, she sells it to Soe, about 40 km from her village. The income from the business enables her to support the needs of her family. 

Nolina desires to purchase more honey to sell. That led her to apply for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan is spent to buy the honey from the collectors near her village.

loans.use: to buy honey

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with a 15-year-old son. Her husband worked as a laborer to support their family. She engages in cosmetology services. She caters to manicure clients to help augment the income of their household. Her business started five years ago. 

Juanita is asking for a loan to buy more materials like nail polish, brushes and cuticle removers to improve her services, thus attracting more customers to seek the services she provides.

In the future, Juanita would like to expand her business and increase her business' profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nail polish, brushes and cuticle removers

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al comercio y cultivo de caña, arroz y ciruela, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración, venta de soya y avena, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, es muy conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para compara envases y un carito para repartir sus productos en los colegios de la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 59 years old. She lives in the district of Cayalti. The people there work in business and grow sugar cane, rice, and plums. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

She has been working for 10 years in preparing and selling soy and oats. Her business is located in her home. She is well known in the area for the work that she does.

She has applied for a loan of 1500 PEN to buy containers and a cart to distribute her products to the schools in the area and in this way have better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers and a cart to distribute her products to schools in the area

loans.name: Daula

texts.en:
Daula is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Misraini, a 46-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children: Anggi, 18, in college; Nona, 16, in the second grade of senior high school; Chong, 8, in third grade of elementary school; and Intan, 7, in second grade of elementary school. 

Daula owns a minivan business for rent to transport goods. The income from the business helps Daula cover her family's living expenses as well as the school fees of her children. Last month, the car broke down, so Daula should buy new spare parts to replace the old ones. This led Daula to request a loan in the amount of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 47 years old and married.  She has two children, who are in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Roselyn has been fattening pigs for six years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is 32 years old and from the village of  Chitatskari.  She is married, with three young children. Marika’s husband works at an agricultural company and gets a monthly salary. Marika is an internally displaced person (IDP), and for this reason the family gets small-sized social assistance from the government. 

Marika’s economic activity is her dairy farm, with two milk cows and two calves.  During grazing season, when her cows give the family enough milk, Marika produces dairy products: cheese and yogurt, for selling as well as family consumption.  Now, the milk she gets is not enough for making production, and Marika is seeking an additional source of income. 

Marika is requesting a loan to start a clothing sales business.  She will purchase apparel and household items and sell them from her house among community members. She will offer her customers quality things at accessible prices. Marika will even take orders for some clothes and items and hopes she will obtain good income. 

Marika wants her children to have an education with the hope of a better economic future than hers. She hopes her business initiative will give her a chance to make savings for her children's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is 31 years old and married. He lives with his wife in the Telavi district of east Georgia. 

Nowadays the family is out of a source of income. Valerian decided to start a business and requested a loan. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of USD 2,500 will help Valerian to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. 

Valerian is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Valerian is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a car and begin a taxi business

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan, 52, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

They started this business seven years ago. They sell meals to people in her community. Thuan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture to better satisfy her customers and pay for her children's school fee.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying new furniture and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
La joven María de 27  años  de edad,  es soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de su madre,  se dedica desde hace  05  años al negocio de venta de ropa interior y ropa para damas y caballeros, su venta es de forma ambulante.
María sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario visita y que le visitan en su casa, también vende en las meloneras donde en las época de pago vende bastante y obtiene buenas ganancias, es licenciada en administración de empresas pero pese a la necesidad de empleo en el País, ella se ha dedicado al negocio.
María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de braseares, blúmeres, blusas, camisetas, pantalones, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades, es un cliente nuevo para Prisma. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y tener un lugar estable donde vender su mercadería. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
This young woman, María, is 27 years old, unmarried and does not have children who depend on her. She lives in her mother’s house and for the past five years has made a living selling underwear and clothing for men and women. She is a street vendor. Her customers are friends and people she visits daily and who visit her in her home. She also sells at the melon packaging firms on pay day where she has good sales and makes a good profit. She has a degree in business administration however despite employment needs in the country, she has applied herself to running her own business.

María is requesting a loan to purchase brassieres, briefs, blouses, shirts, pants, etc. With support from the loan she intends to improve her business and earn more profit. She is a new client for Prisma. Her dream is to improve her business and to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase brassieres, briefs, blouses, shirts and pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts of mobile phones and increase his sales

loans.name: Phu

texts.en:
Phu, 30, is married and has one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. They started this business two years ago. They sell broken rice with pork to people in their community. 

Phu is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying new dishes and better quality ingredients, to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying new dishes and better quality ingredients, to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Fredis

texts.es: Fredis de 42 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa e hijos. Toda su vida ha trabajado la tierra como jornalero y de esa forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su familia es lo más importante y es por quien trabaja duramente para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Hace mucho tiempo comenzó la construcción de la cocina pero por falta de dinero no logro terminar y las paredes quedaron a medias. Esta es la razón por la que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, hierro, cemento, arena y grava para terminar de construir la cocina.
texts.en: Fredis, who is 42 years old, lives in his own house along with his wife and children. All his life he has worked the land as a day laborer, and in this way he brings sustenance to his household. His family is the most important thing for him, and it is for them that he works hard to give them better living conditions. A long time ago he started the construction of the kitchen, but for lack of money he didn't manage to finish, and the walls are still half built. This is why he is applying to FUSAI for this loan, to invest in the purchase of bricks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel to finish building the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel to finish building the kitchen.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng isa  25-year-old married woman and a hardworking mother of two small children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery store in her village, where she sells many different kinds of products such as sweets, snacks, cigarettes, noodles, drinks and other miscellaneous things to the local people. She also works the land for rice and cassava cultivation. She has been working these for nearly 14 years. With her little savings, Heng would like to invest it into hog raising business to supplement her income but she realizes that this won’t be enough to make it possible. For this reason, she has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 2,500,000 to buy piglets to place in her built piggery, and also use the remaining balance to buy more products to sell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her businesses will become more feasible and profitable. In the future, Heng aims to diversify her existing business and save enough for the future emergencies of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to place in her built piggery.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh is requesting a new loan to buy rice in bulk. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different kinds of rices to resell to her customers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which in deals in home products. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products for the shop, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits, and be able to pay her children's school fees in the long ran. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand into wholesale. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lydia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar que está conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 12 años y 4 años de edad.  Para él lo más importante es su querida familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo y de esa forma lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del cuarto de la cocina ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias las láminas se han deteriorado y cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Juan, who is 40 years old, lives in his own house along with his family, which consists of his wife and their three children, ages 15, 12, and 4 years old. For him, the most important thing is his beloved family, and it is for them that he works hard to provide the daily sustenance. Juan has worked in agriculture for a long time, and this is how he brings the daily sustenance to his home. He wants to improve their living conditions, and so he is applying to FUSAI for this loan, to invest in the repair of the kitchen, since with time and the rains, the metal sheets have deteriorated, and when it rains, the water leaks in. With the loan, he will buy sheets of galvanized metal and wood.

loans.use: to buy sheets of galvanized metal and wood to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband has been working as a taxi driver. Oanh lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh has run a food stall in front of her house for the past ten years. She sells breads with pork cut into small pieces. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by upgrading her food stall, and pay for her children's school fees. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade her food stall and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a food stall in front of her house. They sell noodles with pork. Yen would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing new furniture and new dishes. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing new furniture and new dishes

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 40 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. Hang has been running a general store in front of her door for 9 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. Hang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase planks and other necessary materials to meet client's order on time

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is 45 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. Lien has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. Lien is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more shampoos, shower cream, and confectionery to stock her store. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more shampoos, shower cream, and confectionery to stock her store

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en: Genadi is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in the small village of Khelvachauri district. His daughter-in-law is a teacher at local school and gets 400 Gel per month. Genadi is involved in agricultural activities. He has 2 cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, he has a land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Genadi is a very hard working man and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. Genadi decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $4000 for purchasing a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, he will transport people and increase the income of his family. With increased income he will provide better living conditions for his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport people

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mason. For eleven years she has operated a soft drink shop in front of her house. 

Loan would like a loan to purchase a new sugarcane juice machine. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Loan also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sugarcane juice machine

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is a 24-year-old taxi driver.  Elhcin is married for two years and has a 1-year-old baby.  His wife, Gunay, is a housewife who takes care of the baby. His family is considered IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their homeland, Fuzuli city.  Now they live in Babi village of the Fuzuli region, near the war zone.  Elchin has applied for a loan in the amount of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for repairs to his car’s salon.  He hopes that after repair his business and monthly income will be better.  Elchin is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for help.  In the future, he wants to buy a new wheel for his car.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his car’s salon.

loans.name: Rosa Morena

texts.es: Rosa de 38 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos de 14 años, 12 años y 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, el cual consiste en la venta de productos de belleza. De esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene a sus hijos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila con baño ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para reguardar el agua lo cual es muy incómodo ya que no cuenta con el vital líquido cerca cuando lo necesita. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento para proceder a construir la pila y lavadero que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 38 years old, is a single mother of three children, ages 14, 12, and 10. She works as a street vendor selling beauty products. In this way she earns a living and supports her children. With the goal of improving their conditions, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the construction of a washroom with a bathroom, since she does not have a suitable place to store water, which is very inconvenient, since she doesn't have this vital liquid nearby when she needs it. She is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of sand, bricks, and cement to proceed to construct the wash room and laundry room that she needs so much.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, and cement to construct a wash room and laundry.

loans.name: Ulda Elizabeth

texts.es: Ulda de 45 años de edad reside en casa  humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 6 años, 9 años y 15 años. Para Ulda  sus hijos son su principal motivación por lo que no se cansa de trabajar y buscar mejores oportunidades de vida. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y de esa forma ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Con el fin de dar condiciones más higiénicas a su familia desea construir una fosa séptica dentro de su terreno. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Confía que con su salario logrará cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: Ulda, who is 45 years old, lives in a house that is simple but is her own, along with her life companion and their three children, ages 6, 9, and 15. For Ulda, her children are her principal motivation, and so she does not tire of working and seeking better opportunities in life. For a long time, she has worked providing domestic services, and in this way she has managed to raise her family. With the goal of giving more hygienic conditions to her family, she wants to build a septic tank on her property. For this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, and iron. She trusts that with her earnings she will succeed in paying off the debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to construct a septic tank

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 47 years old. He is married and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has six children. He is determined to overcome challenges to help his family to get ahead. He is currently operating a clothing store. He knows how to deal well with his customers. So he always tries to purchase clothes so that his customers will feel happy and will be able to recommend him to others. He is doing all he can to provide his family with a good quality of life.

Ali applied for a loan from AMB to buy shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, etc., so that he can increase his profits. He hopes to expand his business to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing (shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Carmila

texts.en:
Carmila is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmila is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmila has been raising pigs for 15 years and she also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 55 years old and married with 3 children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Lan supports her family by selling soft drinks in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell at higher margins. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her family of 5 in their Ger, which is a traditional nomadic yurt. They live in Uvs Province, Mongolia. Her husband helps her to run the family business of clothing retail in the local market. Her older daughter works at a local company and her younger son and daughter are university and secondary school students, respectively.

Uranchimeg started her business at a rental booth in the local market in 2005. She gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is a talkative, hardworking, and determined woman who is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT. She will use this to purchase inventory for mobile sale, to reach a larger number of customers, and to sell at her counter.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory.

loans.name: Barsilisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Barsilisa works hard to support her family. She sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming corn. Barsilisa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of different dried fish to sell.

Barsilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of different dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is a 37-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City.  He has 3 daughters.  He and his wife earn a living selling fried sticky rice, which they have done for 10 years.  Hai would like a loan to buy a new motorcycle to travel to and from the local markets.  He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers.  He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income.  This will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy new motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is a 54-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City.  She has 4 children.  Her husband is a gym trainer.  Hang earns a living by running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, soft drinks and toothpaste.  These will be used to stock her general store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income.  This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods for her store, such as milk, soft drinks, and toothpaste.

loans.name: José Excequias

texts.es:
José de 39 años, es casado y padre de tres hijos de 10, 3 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, es bachiller no siguió estudiando por la situación económica, pues su papá es pobre y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia; su esposa se dedica a vender platos típicos.

 José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 12 años,  con su papá a prendió el trabajo, hoy él agradece  a su padre la enseñanza, pues de esa manera esta sacando su familia a delante; pero desde hace  4 años trabaja cuidando un cañal, su día comienza a las cuatro treinta, mientras su esposa le prepara el desayuno, le ayuda a destusar los elotes para que ella venda por la tarde, elotes, tostadas, papitas etc. luego él se va para el trabajo a las 5:30 AM, camina unos 30 minutos para llegar y regresa a las 6:PM.  

El préstamo sera utilizado, para reparar la casa, pues ya no sirve la lamina que tiene y las paredes son de  adobes y con el agua se están lavando. Con el préstamo comprara, 2 docenas de laminas, 8 polines, 20 bolsas de cemento, una camionada de arena, y lo demás para mano de obra.  


Su sueño en un futuro, es comprar un terreno, porque, en el que hoy vive es de su hermano, su hermano le dio para que construyera la casa, y sueña que sus hijos se gradúen en una carrera universitaria, ya que él no lo logro.
texts.en:
José, 39, is married and the father of three children, ages 10, 3, and 2.  He graduated from high school but didn't continue with his education because his father's poor and he had to work to help his family.  His wife sells traditional food.

José has made a living in agriculture since he was 12.  He learned this job from his father and is grateful to him for it now because he's getting his family ahead.  For four years he has worked taking care of an irrigation channel.

His day begins at 4:30 a.m.  While his wife prepares his breakfast he helps her shuck the corn that she'll sell later in the day with tostadas, potatoes, and so forth.  Then he goes to work for 5:30 a.m., walking some 30 minutes to get there; he returns home at 6 p.m.

He's going to use the loan to repair his house because the metal roofing is no longer good and the adobe walls are washing away from the rain.  With the loan he's going to buy 2 dozen metal sheets, 8 pillars, 20 bags of cement, and a truckload of sand; the rest he'll use to pay for labor.

José dreams of buying a plot of land in the future because where he lives now belongs to his brother, who gave it to him to build a house.  He also dreams of his children graduating from college because he wasn't able to.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El  señor  Alejandro tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de su mamá. Se dedica al servicio de transporte con una antigüedad de dos años en la empresa de radio taxis "EJECUTIVO" en calidad de propietario de su mismo vehículo, además tiene una segunda actividad económica,  en la que se dedica como propietario al servicio de atención de eventos sociales con vajilla incluida, los  ingresos provenientes de ambas actividades sirven para poder cubrir sus gastos. Actualmente necesita un mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo por ello requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para que pueda arreglarlo y quede en buenas condiciones para seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en: Alejandro is twenty-six years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He has been working for two years as a taxi driver for EJECUTIVO, a radio taxi company, as an independent taxicab owner. In addition, he has a second business activity; he is the owner of a catering service that also provides tableware. The income from both activities is used to cover his expenses. Currently, he needs to pay for the maintenance and repair of his taxi; for this reason, he needs a loan of Bs. 10200 to repair his taxi and keep it in good condition in order to continue generating an income.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his tires into winter tires to secure safety, and to pay his mother's medical fee.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has no children currently in school. For the past five years, Alfred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which handles general products. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for the expansion of the business by purchasing more items, and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and to increase the family income. Alfred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own an expanded business with various outlets. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the business by purchasing more items.

loans.name: Farba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Farba, âgé de 36 ans, évolue dans le secteur de l’agriculture depuis plus de 6 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Pour préparer  la campagne de pastèques, Farba a besoin d’une somme de 150000 CFA pour acheter des semences et démarrer. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit à l’IMCEC et cherche une collaboration durable pour hisser son activité à un niveau plus haut. 
Farba s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et veille pour que cette dernière soit dans les meilleures conditions. 
Farba désire agrandir son champ et varier ses cultures voire faire des cultures maraichères.
texts.en:
Mr. Farba, age 36, has evolved in the agricultural sector for over six years. He is married and a father.

To prepare for the watermelon season, Farba needs a sum of 150,000 CFA francs to buy seeds and get started. This is his first credit loan with IMCEC and he is seeking a long-term collaboration to lift his business to a higher level.

Farba handles his family's daily expenses and ensures that they have the best living conditions possible.

Farba proposes to increase the size of his field and vary his crops, or even grow market garden crops.

loans.use: buy watermelon seeds to grow and sell when ready

loans.name: Mukundane Group

texts.fr:
Astère fait partie du groupe  Mukundane et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Emmanuella. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 4 mois à 5 ans, 3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son petit frère qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de restaurant  depuis  9 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de 50kg de riz,130 kg de haricot, et  20 litres d’huile de palme à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une deuxième parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Astère is part of the Mukundane group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Emmanuella. They have three children aged from four months to five years. Altogether three children attend school, as his little brother is also under his care and goes to school.

He has been in the restaurant business for the past nine years.

This is his seventh credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy 50 kilos of rice, 130 kilos of beans and 20 liters of palm oil to resell once cooked in his restaurant, to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to buy a second plot of land and see that his children study.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy 50 kilos of rice, 130 kilos of beans and 20 liters of palm oil for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds.

Helen has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from jeepney transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh is a 63-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. Her husband is now retied. Linh earns a living running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. Linh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk and confectionery to stock her general store and to buy food ingredients for making jelly for selling. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as milk, confectionery and food ingredients for making jelly.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is a 65-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Anh earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 20 years. Anh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, eggs, milk and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, eggs, milk and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Madame Ama est revendeuse de mèches et produits de beauté depuis 2004. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants de 10 et 05ans scolarisés. Son premier prêt sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux mieux aux besoins des clients. Elle espère à l'avenir assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants tout en gardant son activité pérenne .
texts.en:
Mrs. Ama is a retailer of hair extensions and beauty products since 2004. She is married and the mother of two children aged five and ten years, both of whom attend school.

This first loan requested from WAGES will enable her to buy more goods to better meet the needs of customers.

She hopes in the future to ensure better education for her children while pursuing her sustainable business.

loans.use: buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Akoueba

texts.fr: Âgée de 48ans, Akoueba pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, revend de la viande d'agouti et du lapin au marché. Avec une ancienneté de 25ans dans l'activité, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de viande. Elle espère développer son activité et assurer une meilleure éducation ses enfants de 26 et 12ans.
texts.en:
Akoueba is 48 years old. To contribute to the family's needs, she resells agouti (large rodent) and rabbit meat at the market. With 25 years' experience in the business, she is requesting her first loan to buy more meat.

She hopes to expand her business and provide better education for her children, who are 12 and 26 years old.

loans.use: buy agouti (large rodent) and rabbit meat

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely de 39 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 años y 14 años de edad. Aracely trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos tales como yuca frita,  papas fritas y pastelitos de carne. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y así logra dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Aracely es una mujer muy visionaria y cada día busca oportunidades para sacarles el mejor provecho. Desea reparar el techo de uno de los cuartos de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorada y cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Además, desea construir una fosa séptica para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI y así comprar lámina galvanizada, madera, ladrillo, arena y cemento para reparar el techo del cuarto y construir la fosa séptica lo antes posible.
texts.en: Aracely, who's thirty-nine years old, is a single mother of two children, aged fourteen and sixteen. Aracely works very hard to support her home. For eight years, she has been selling snacks such as fried cassava, french fries, and meat pies. This business is her main source of income, and in this way she's able to provide her children with what's necessary. Aracely is a very visionary woman, and every day she looks to make the most out of her opportunities. She wants to repair the roof of one of her rooms since it's currently dilapidated and it leaks when it rains. In addition, she wants to build a septic tank; for this reason, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, brick, sand, and cement to repair the roof and build the septic tank as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, brick, sand, and cement to repair her roof and build a septic tank.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Veuve de 46ans, Yawa a 01 enfant de 12ans scolarisé en charge. Pour subvenir à leurs besoins, elle revend des tubercules à domicile et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. C'est en 2002 qu'elle a crée son activité. Le profit l'aidera à assurer une meilleure éducation à son enfant et plus subvenir à leurs besoins.
texts.en:
A 64-year-old widow, Yawa has one 12-year-old child to care for, who attends school.

To meet their needs, she resells tubers from her home and is requesting a first loan to buy more goods. She created her business in 2002.

The profits will help ensure a better education for her child and also help meet their needs.

loans.use: Buy corn and yams

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh is a 38-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an embroiderer while Chinh earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 14 years. Chinh would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of stock for her store, such as shampoos, shower creams and softeners. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. The boost to her business will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store, such as shampoos, shower creams and softeners

loans.name: Sitheang

texts.en:
Sitheang is a 47-year-old resident of Baray district in the Kampong Thom province of Cambodia, where she farms rice and raises piglets. Thanks to these businesses and her effort, she is able to provide enough for her four children’s needs. She has been running these businesses for more than six years with the full support of her husband.

Sitheang successfully paid off a previous loan with HKL. As this will be her second loan, she will use it to buy piglets and more feed to keep fattening her pigs. When they reach maturity, Sitheang hopes to sell her pigs to the markets or local traders for a good price. In the future, she hopes to save enough to expand her rice farm and enlarge her piggery.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to keep fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet, 40, is married with two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a mechanic while Tuyet supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business four years ago. Tuyet is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods such as soya sauce, fish sauce, eggs, and different kinds of canned food, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, such as soya sauce, fish sauce, eggs and various canned goods

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.
Argentina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Argentina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Argentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Due to the hardships of earning a living, Maricel assisted her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They planned to expand their plantation but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for corn production. Through this loan, she believes that someday they will improve their corn production and give her family a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for corn production

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is a 38-year-old man. He has one child. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have been running a business selling clothing for eight years. Hoang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell in the new year. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell in the new year

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is an excellent farmer as well as a good mother to her son. She has been a widow for many years now and began her own business growing crops and vegetables after her husband died because she needed to make money. 
Nowadays she runs her business successfully, growing wheat and potatoes with the help of her son. However, although she works very hard, she receives only a small income. She wants to sow her crops this autumn but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 1000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and fertilizers. Jumagul is going to hold a wedding party for her son with the profit and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell during the winter in her food stall business.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Homme de 42ans, Mr Kodjo pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille(mariée et père de 02 enfants de 16 et  13ans),revend des pièces détachées auto à ses clients. Sa première demande faite à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Il souhaite à l’avenir avoir un grand étalage et bien nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodjo is 42 years old, married, and a father of two children, who are 13 and 16 years old. He supports his family's needs by reselling spare auto parts. 

His first loan with WAGES will allow him to buy more parts in order to satisfy his customers. 

In the future, he would like to have a large area to display his goods and also be able to feed his family well.
