Juan has been selling filled tamales for 2 years and every 6 months he works in the agriculture industry. 

Nubia has been selling "nacatamales" [steamed corn cakes] for the past 5 years.

loans.use: to buy and transport raw material such as corn, bundles of leaves, firewood, lime and ash.

loans.name: Las Barbies Gold Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres mujeres luchadoras una de ellas es Verónica tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada, con dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, su negocio es el alquiler de nintendo, venta de helados y refrescos en su domicilio desde hace 1 año y medio. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 3 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de play station y un TV de 21 pulgadas a color. Karla mujer de 20 años su negocio es venta de sandalias y ropa nueva, Yolanda tiene la edad de 23 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group is made up of three feisty women, one of whom is 26-year-old Verónica.  She has a partner and two children, aged seven and three years old.  Verónica has a business renting out a Nintendo console, and selling ice cream and soft drinks from her home.  She has had this business for one and a half years, and has been a member of the communal bank for three years.  Verónica is applying for this loan in order to buy a PlayStation and a 21-inch colour television.  Karla is 20 years old and has a business selling sandals and new clothes.  Yolanda is 23 years old and has a business selling new clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy a PlayStation and a 21-inch colour television.

loans.name: Jenovis Alejandra

texts.es: Jenovis es una muchacha de 21 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 1 año, tiene a una persona particular que le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de insumos como platos, cucharas, descartables, arroz, aceite, frijoles, leña, repollos, cucharas, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, bastimento, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, ajo, naranja agria, achote, queso, verduras, etc.
texts.en: Jenovis is 21 years old, single, and has a son.  She has had a business selling meals for one year and has an employee who helps her with this business.  Jenovis is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies such as plates, spoons, disposable dishes, rice, oil, beans, firewood, cabbage, red meat, chicken, pork, containers, natural colouring, onion, tomatoes, garlic, bitter oranges, sweet peppers, cheese, vegetables, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as plates, spoons, disposable dishes, rice, oil, beans, firewood, cabbage, red meat, chicken, pork, containers, natural colouring, onion, tomatoes, garlic, bitter oranges, sweet peppers, cheese, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Francis Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos es Francis mujer de 36 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos es su comunidad, y venta de nacatamales es su domicilio desde hace 3 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para  la compra de insumos para la elaboración de nacatamales como hojas de chagüites, mecates, maíz, carne de cerdo, papa, achote, naranja agria,  arroz, chiltoma, cebolla y cosméticos como perfumes de varón, perfumes de damas, cremas, lociones, maquillajes, pinturas de uñas, labiales, etc. Margarita mujer de 66 años su negocio es la venta de sopa y frijoles cocidos, Francisco tiene la edad de 56 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: This group is made up of three business owners.  One is 36-year-old Francis.  She has a partner and two children and has had a business selling cosmetics in her local area for three years.  Francis also sells "nacatamales" (a typical Nicaraguan dish) from her home.  Francis has been with the communal bank for five years and is applying for another loan in order to buy supplies for preparing the "nacatamales".  She will buy banana leaves, cords, corn, pork, potatoes, natural colouring, bitter oranges, rice, sweet peppers, onion, and cosmetics, such as colognes, perfumes, creams, lotions, make-up, nail varnish, lipstick, and more.  Margarita is 66 years old and sells soup and cooked beans.  Francisco is 56 years old and has a business selling used clothes.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, cords, corn, pork, potatoes, natural colouring, bitter oranges, rice, sweet peppers, onion, and cosmetics, such as colognes, perfumes, creams, lotions, make-up, nail varnish, lipstick, and more.

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios trabajadoras una de ellas es Alma tiene la edad de 40 años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, queso, frijoles cocidos en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, queso, leña, Frijoles. Yamileth mujer de 33 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y hielo, Maritza mujer de 30 años su negocio es una mini pulpería
texts.en: This group is made up of three hard-working members, one of whom is 40-year-old Alma.  She is married and has two children.  For five years she has had a business selling, tortillas, cheese, and beans, which she cooks at home.  Alma has been a member of the communal bank for two years and is applying for this loan in order to buy a hundredweight of corn, cheese, firewood, and beans.  Yamileth is 33 years old and has a business selling "nacatamales" (a typical Nicaraguan dish) and ice.  Maritza is 30 years old and has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a hundredweight of corn, cheese, firewood, and beans.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, a una hora con 30 minutos a la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, pollos, pavos en su mismo domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comparar víveres y golosinas para colocar un bodeguita en su domicilio y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 49 years old and lives in the District of Nueva Arica, an area that is known for agriculture and livestock breeding. This community is located an hour and 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells animals such as ducks, chickens, and turkeys from her home. Luz is an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN in order to buy food products and sweets so that she can open a small grocery store in her home. This will enable her to generate additional income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products and sweets so that she can open a grocery store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell. Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nanette is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Nanette has a direct selling personal collection, Avon and Natasha products business in the Philippines. Nanette requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock like lipsticks, lotions, shampoo, body soap, etc. to sell.

Nanette has been in this business for 20 years. Nanette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like lipsticks, lotions, shampoo, body soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell. Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Sangar

texts.en:
Sangar is 33 years old and lives in Kakata. She is married and her husband is a local businessman. They have two children, ages 5 and 2. Her children live with her and attend school. 

For the past ten years Sangar has been sewing and selling uniforms, African outfits,  etc. in the local market. Sometimes she makes less profit because she buys the sewing material at a higher price. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing material like cloth, poplin, etc. In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials like cloth, poplin, etc.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in the Ddmashen village, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. All of his family members are engaged in farming, and it is the only source of income for his family. They have cows, calves, piglets, horses, and chickens on their farm. They also cultivate potatoes on their plot of land. 

The house in which his family lives has not been repaired for 20 years, and he wants to start repairing it. Gagik requests a loan for 200,000 AMD in order to install new windows in his house.

loans.use: to install new windows in his house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 53 years old. She is divorced and lives in the village of Vazisubani ("Street of Vine"--in Georgian) with her retired parents and two daughters. Mariam works as a veterinarian in her district and gets a small monthly salary. Her earnings are modest and Mariam decided to start up a business to earn extra money. 

With the loan, Mariam will rent a store, install shelves and purchase merchandise for setting up a general store. She will buy a variety of household and daily-use consumer products and sell them from her store. Her daughters will help her in that business. 

Mariam hopes her project will be profitable and generate income for improving the family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to start up a general store

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik lives in Kapan city which is in the Syunik region. Borik is very happy to have this deal with Kiva. He asked for this loan in order to develop his new business, which is producing refreshing drinks. He operates his business in a small workshop, and his wife helps him greatly in his business. Borik distributes his product to different shops and markets in his city. Borik’s first deal with Kiva helped him to buy some new beehives, wax and frames for his beekeeping business, in which he is still doing well.

Borik asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some raw materials for his refreshing drinks business.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials for his refreshing drinks business.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam, 46, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter. She is widowed and earns money through running a general store. She would like to get a loan to buy fast food, noodles, confectionary, and softdrinks to sell and meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, fast food, confectionary and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah lives in the Kisii area of Nyanza outside of Kenya. He is blessed with 8 children and has been farming for 10 years. He practices mixed farming where he sells milk, eggs, tea and some vegetables. Although he experiences the challenge of eradicating pests and diseases, he enjoys dairy farming and the milk produced by his cows.

Zephaniah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he heard that they fund dairy farmers and he wanted a dairy loan. During the training received, he learned how to develop a culture of savings. Seeing that he has many children, Zephaniah says that this loan will provide more milk for his family, and also selling the milk will bring in more income and thus improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
The group comprises two persons who reside in the same district and who run revenue-generating businesses. The group's representative, Beatrice, is 73 years old. She has a middle school education and is a widow. She has three children, all grown up. She lives with her children in the house her husband built for them. She makes sure all household expenses are covered. 

For this reason, Beatrice has been selling groceries from her home for about twenty-five years. She gets her supplies from the wholesale market in Ghana. With the goal of bolstering her business, she joined the other member of this group to request a fifth loan from ID-Ghana. The previous ones were indeed paid back.

They need a total amount of GHS 2300 to supplement their working capital so that they can serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy grocery items at wholesale prices to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak, 26, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with one son. To make a living, she has been farming rice and sometimes works for others for a fee. Her current business earns her about 26,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Lak’s group micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and they are first time borrowers. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Al-Sraha Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Sraha, and consists of 4 ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Lamia is 31 years old and lives with her family in Aden, Yemen. She sells ladies' clothes, incense, perfumes and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. She works hard to offer a good life for her family. She has a regular customer base, because they prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that she offers. She is a resourceful and honest woman, dedicated to her work. She applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, food and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.ru:
Холмуроду 54 года. Он муж и отец троих детей. Его дети уже взрослые старшему сыну 30 лет. Он работает заграницей. Дочке 20 лет, а младшему сыну 18 лет. Холмурод более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. С юных лет и до сегодняшнего дня он работал и работает на земле. Возле дома у Холмурода имеется земельный участок, где он сажает овощи. В этой не легкой работе ему активно помогает его семья. 
    Холмурод собирается взять кредит, чтобы подготовить землю к осеннему посеву и посадить урожай. На сумму кредита он закупит минеральный удобрений и семян. Холмурод считает, что мир не без добрых людей, и ему обязательно помогут с кредитом.
texts.en:
Kholmurod is 54 years old.  He is a husband and the father of three children, who are all adults.  The eldest is 30 years old and works abroad.  He has a 20 year old daughter and his youngest is an 18 year old son.  Kholmurod has been in the agriculture business for more than 20 years, but he has worked in the fields since he was very young.  Kholmurod owns a parcel of land near his home where he grows vegetables.  This is not easy work and his family takes an active part in helping him.  

Kholmurod is getting ready to take out a loan in order to prepare his land for the autumn planting and to plant his crops.  He will use the loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seed.  Kholmurod believes that the world is not without good people who will surely help him with this loan.

loans.use: to plant his crops

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Las Bellas De San Judas Group

texts.es: Tres son las socias que integran a este grupo una de ellas es Ana María mujer de 30 años de edad, viuda, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos ambulante en su comunidad desde hace 1 año y medio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de zapatos de varón, de mujer, sandalias,  perfumes, cremas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, etc. Yadira mujer de 44 años su negocio es alquilar parqueos y venta de cosméticos, Wendolyn mujer de 27 años su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
There are three members in this group.  María is one of them.  She is a 30 year old widow.  Her business has been selling clothes and cosmetics in an itinerant manner in her community for one and a half years.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy men’s and women’s shoes, sandals, perfumes, creams, blouses, pants, shirts, and t-shirts, etc.

Yadira, age 44, has a business renting parking spaces and selling cosmetics.  Wendolyn, age 27, has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s shoes, sandals, perfumes, creams, blouses, pants, shirts, and t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married woman and parent of one child, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a manicure and pedicure service. Marites is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell at her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities with her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 25 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 11. All five of her children live at home with her; the older ones are attending school. 

For four years Marilyn has been selling shoes. She sells to some of her customers on credit and sometimes it's difficult for her to collect payments. She started the business with money from her boyfriend. She was not able to complete the 9th grade. 

Marilyn has requested a loan to purchase more shoes. In the future Marilyn hopes to be doing business internationally and wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафару 51 год. Он живет с женой и двумя детьми в селе Холмурод-Теппа уже много лет. Его старший сын работает в Российской Федерации. Он уехал, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия своей семьи.
   Музафар занимается растениеводством. В течение долгих лет Музафар работает на грядке сажает овощи в том числе картошку и огурцы. На данный момент Музафар берет кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для обработки земли и горючей смеси для трактора. Музафар хочет успеть посадить картошку до прихода зимы, поэтому он торопиться.  Музафар ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Muzafar is 51 years old and for many years he has lived with his wife and two children in the village of Kholmurod-Teppa.  His eldest son left to work in Russia in order to improve the family's living conditions.  

Muzafar is in the agriculture business.  For many years, Muzafar has grown vegetables including potatoes and cucumbers in raised beds.  Currently he is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilzers for his land and fuel for his tractor.  Muzafar is in a hurry because he hopes to be done planting before the onset of winter.  Muzafar is relying on your help!

loans.use: to buy fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Claudia tiene la edad de 30 años, acompañada, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de frijoles cocidos, cuajadas, leña en su domicilio desde hace 7 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de flete de leña, quinal de frijoles, queso para las cuajaditas. Martha tiene 51 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas, pozol y leña, Reyna tiene 42 años su negocio es la venta de pozol, tiste, semilla de jícaro.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three hard-working members.  Claudia, age 30, is one of them.  She is in a relationship, and she has three children under her care.  She has been selling cooked beans, wood, and curds at her house for seven years.  She has been a client with the institution for one year.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a load of firewood, a ‘quintal’ [100 pounds] of beans, and cheese for the curds.

Martha, age 51, has a business selling tortillas, ‘pozole’ [a type of hominy soup], and firewood.  Reyna, age 42, has a business selling pozol, ‘tiste’ [herbal tea], and calabash seeds.

loans.use: to buy a load of firewood, a ‘quintal’ [100 pounds] of beans, and cheese for the curds.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is 33 years old and a married woman. She has been blessed with two children who live with her and her husband in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province. To earn a living, Phorn and her husband are in the business of making and selling rattan products in local regions. She also buys rattan products and beds from other villagers to resell for a profit. Through her hardships, she is able to make approximately 12 USD per day.

To help her further develop her business, she would like to acquire a loan in the amount of 1,500 USD as working capital to buy rattan products and beds to resell. This loan will enable her to sustain her business and make a consistent income for her family. Phorn and her family rely heavily on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to buy rattan products and beds to resell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 59 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. She is married and has six children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her medicine shop, which provides various medications.

To help expand her business, Immaculate requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a vehicle to improve her transportation situation. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Immaculate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: La Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios trabajadores y luchadores uno de ellos Noelia mujer de 37 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace 18 años. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como es cerdo, tocino, maíz, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, hoja, manteca, mecate, arroz, papa, achote, naranja agria, etc. Oliver tiene 29 años su negocio es venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 6 años, María tiene 24 años su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three hard-working and tenacious members.  Noelia is one of them.  She is 37 years old, and she is in a relationship.  She has been selling ‘nacatamales’ [Nicaraguan style tamales] at her house for 18 years.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like pork, bacon, corn, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, banana leaves, shortening, twine, rice, potatoes, annatto, and bitter orange, etc.

Oliver, age 29, has had a business selling new and used clothes for six years.  María, age 24, has had a grocery store business for two years.

loans.use: to buy supplies like pork, bacon, corn, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, banana leaves, shortening, twine, rice, potatoes, annatto, and bitter orange, etc.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 35 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Neneth works very hard to provide for them.

Neneth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of products like canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Neneth has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Neneth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a buy-and-sell food supplements business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of food supplements to sell to her customers. Myrna has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food supplements to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows, calves, and cattle feed

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en la comunidad de Aguirre del municipio de Sacaba, se dedica a la actividad agrícola,  cultiva en su terreno propio que es herencia de sus padres  en el cual produce papa, oca y haba, con rotación de cultivos además cuenta con experiencia en el rubro. Como actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres  requiere un crédito para la construcción de una vivienda propia y de esta forma  independizarse.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio is 21 years old, single, and lives in the community of Aguirre in the town of Sacaba. He is a farmer who cultivates a plot of land that he inherited from his parents. José Antonio grows potatoes, oca (a tuber produced in the Andes), and beans. He rotates his crops and also has experience in this line of work.

José Antonio currently lives at his parents' house, so he is requesting a loan so that he can build a home of his own. This will allow him to become independent.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past 21 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her business selling food stuffs & beverages. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beverages, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and help her family renovate the existing rentals. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to other areas. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beverages.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a 14,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucecita Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias microempresarias luchadoras una de ellas María tiene la edad de 35 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 1 año, el crédito lo está requiriendo para la compra de granos básicos  como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, jabones, ace, cloro, embutidos, pollo, crema, leche, chiverías, leña, productos de belleza. Ericka tiene la edad de 21 años su negocio es la venta de trucha y bisutería, Gema tiene la edad de 22 años su negocio es la venta de gaseosa, agua y chiverías.
texts.en:
There are three women in this group of hardworking businesswomen. One of them is 34-year old María who is married and has two children. She has run a grocery store out of her house for one year. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy basics such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, washing powder, bleach, cold cuts, chicken, mayo, milk, dairy products, firewood, and beauty products. 

Ericka is 21 years old and sells trout and costume jewelry.  Gema is 22 years old and sells soft drinks, water, and dairy products.

loans.use: Buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is married with five children, and five of her children go to school. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from selling samosas and chapatti.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to becoming a wholesaler, buying a plot of land, and building a house.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they are always giving timely loans. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Gerailda

texts.en: Gerailda  is married with four children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members - her grandchildren. She has a business of selling rice and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,800,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of rice. She works in a shop and sells on a wholesale basis seven days out of every week.  She generates additional income from rental rooms and selling piped water. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to build more rental rooms and to start going to villages for rice.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they reach out to the bottom poor. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al comercio en general, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la elaboración de chicha de jora, una bebida que se preparaba en tiempos de los Incas, ubicado en Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y piqueos, su negocio se encuentra en su domicilio, Marleny nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Marleny ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para arreglar el local de su negocio y así tener un lugar agradable para acoger a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar la demanda, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the District of Buenos Aires. This area is known for general trade, but her community is especially known for making "chicha de jora", a beverage that was prepared during the time of the Incas. Marleny lives in Morropon, which is two hours away from the city of Piura and located near the northern coast of Peru.

She sells "chicha de jora", beer, and snacks. Marleny's business is located in her home. She says that her business allows her to assist her husband with their family's expenses. Marleny is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to renovate the location of her business. This will allow her to have a larger space where she can accommodate her customers. This will increase demand and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to renovate the location of her business.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 36 years old and he lives in the village Zovaber which is in Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has two children. Together with his wife he is engaged in farming. In their small farm they have four sheep and three lambs, but this is not the only occupation that Gegham is engaged in to earn his family’s living. 

All over the Gegharkunik region Gegham drives in his own car and collects the hides of cattle that have been slaughtered and he resells them. In this way Gegham increases his family’s income.

Now Gegham is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy more leather to resell.

loans.use: to buy more leather and then re-sell it

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 69 years old and comes from Olkalou. She is married to Nyaga and they are blessed with four children who are all adults.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last 25 years . She has applied for her fifth loan of Kshs. 80,000 from Kadet Ltd, which will be used to buy a dairy cow.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 30,000 and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan to Kadet Ltd and to buy some more dairy cows.

She hopes to become an established dairy farmer in her region.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rezeda

texts.en:
Rezeda is a student of AUCA, in the department of International and Business Law. Here is her story.

"The most important period in life for the person is the choice of future profession. Therefore, it is necessary to approach to this choice very carefully, considering all pluses and minuses, to understand whether you will be able to be engaged in the chosen business for the rest of the life. I have done my choice and decided to study in International and Business Law department. As I consider, a lawyer has to have a huge stock of merits, such as responsibility, logical thinking, persistence, confidence, good memory, initiative, emotional stability.

"It is inconceivable to imagine the worthy lawyer without the following human qualities such as fairness, honesty, justice, responsiveness, humanity, a feeling of honor, decency, respect, conscientiousness, high idea of a professional duty. It is by far not the complete list, but I believe that the main qualities were noted by me. 

"Everything that I listed is close to me. For this reason I choose the profession of lawyer. Also, a legal education promotes development of the personality as it includes studying historical, public and social disciplines, which are very interesting to me.

"My profession will allow me to help people who need my help. Barriers and difficulties which will get in my way of study time and also after it attract me and give a peculiar motivation to development. I want to help people and constantly feel that I am necessary to them. 

"AUCA will give me a quality education by means of which I will be able to achieve my goals. I very hope to study in AUCA, where I will learn from qualified teachers, experts of their business. I plan to increase the acquired knowledge and courageously to go by my own way [to a] bright future. Modern society needs good experts of law, which I hope to become. Amongst other opportunities, AUCA provides financial aid to all its students, through Kiva loans. I would also like to take the opportunity and apply for [a] Kiva loan. It will give me a great ability to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en:
Artavazd is a 33-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Tsaghkunq, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He has a small, nice family - a daughter and a son. His wife does not work and she helps him in the farming activities very much. Artavazd owns a very rich and cute farm. It has four cows, three bulls, two calves, thirty sheep, fifteen lambs, and five piglets. The dairy-products and potatoes he cultivates, he sells through re-sellers, and the meat he sells to local butchers.

Artavazd, together with farming, also does construction work, and in this way he tries to enlarge his family income.
Artavazd asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, since he did not manage to collect any yet and is worried how his farm cattle will pass the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Bahati, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children, a boy and a girl. One of them goes to school and the other one is still young.  She has been making and selling soap since 2007.  She works from 11.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Bahati's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the stock whenever she got the new loan. She and her family are happy with the loans.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and built her house. She will use this loan to buy more equipment for making soap.  She dreams of improving her business.  

Bahati will share this loan with her loan group "Kisiwani" with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for making soap.

loans.name: Reyna Patricia

texts.es: Reyna es una joven de 27 años de edad, soltera y aun no tiene hijos, es Licenciada en Contabilidad y trabaja para una empresa privada. Reyna habita con su numerosa familia en un barrio pobre de Managua, el cual tiene mucha presencia delincuencial a todas horas del día, por tal razón desea terminar la construcción de anexo de un cuarto que está en la parte exterior de su casa, lo que le permitirá tener mayor seguridad y privacidad. Solicita este primer crédito para comprar los materiales como bloques, cemento, hierro, arena que le hace falta para continuar la obra
texts.en:
Reyna is a young woman who is 27 years of age, single, and has no children. She has a degree in Accounting and works for a private company. Reyna lives with her large family in a poor neighborhood of Managua that experiences a great deal of crime throughout the day. For this reason, she wants to finish the construction of a room that is connected to part of the exterior of her house. This will provide greater security and privacy.

Reyna is requesting her first loan so that she can buy materials such as blocks, cement, iron, and sand so that the work can continue.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, and sand for adding a room to her house.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 52 years old and comes from Nyahururu. He is a widower and supports his three children aged 24, 17 and 5 years old.

He has been operating his farming business for the last five years. To enable him to hire laborers to assist him with maize harvesting and shelling, he has applied for his third loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 15,000 and he has plans of using the anticipated profit from his business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd.

In the future, he hopes to buy a tractor and for his children to be successful.

loans.use: To hire laborers to assist with harvesting and shelling his maize

loans.name: Jehova Jirex Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias luchadoras una de ellas es Martha tiene la edad de 51 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio  desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como arroz, carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, verduras, carbón, queso, plátanos, repollo, leña, cebolla, chiltoma, ajo, naranja agria, tomate, achote, gaseosas. Ivania tiene 45 años su negocio es la venta de comida y María Justina su negocio es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three hard-working members, one of whom is Martha. Martha is 51 years old and single. For the last four years, her business has been the sale of food in her home. She is asking for the loan to buy raw material like rice, beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, coal, cheese, plantains, cabbage, firewood, onion, sweet peppers, garlic, bitter orange, tomato, annatto and soft drinks. 

Ivania is 45 years old and her business is the sale of food, and María Justina's business is the sale of food.

loans.use: to buy raw material like rice, beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, coal, cheese, plantains, cabbage, firewood, onion, sweet peppers, garlic, bitter orange, tomato, annatto and soft drinks.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik was born in the village of Shikahogh, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has a son who lives and works in Yerevan city, and a daughter who is married and lives with her family. 

Norik, having already had two successful deals with Kiva, has decided to cooperate for the third time. He, together with his wife, continues his agricultural and farming activities; they have cows, a bull, piglets and chickens. They sell their farm products (milk, butter and cheese, eggs and meat) to their neighbors and loyal customers. 

Norik asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy three more calves and some animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy three more calves and some animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming bananas and vegetables in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vicenta has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan lives in the city of Ijevan, which is in the Tavush region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. Ivan’s son works as a computer operator and his wife works at the privet company as a cleaner. Ivan for many years has worked as a driver and it is already 13 years that he has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. He has many loyal customers and all of them like him very much, since, as they say, Ivan is a very attentive driver and kind person.

Ivan is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy car tires for the winter season in order to safely drive his customers.

loans.use: to buy car tires for the winter season in order to safely drive his customers.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 61 years old and lives in the village of Achajur, which is in the Tavush region. She is married and has a large family - three daughters, who are already married and live separately with their families, and a son. She lives with her husband, son, and father-in-law and mother-in-law, who are already retired.

Narine and her family members are engaged in farming and agriculture. They have a very nice orchard full of apple and peach trees, and a very nice vineyard. They also have farm cattle - three cows, three piglets, twenty chickens and three beehives. 

So they manage to sell meat, various dairy-products, eggs, honey, and fruits, and they also sell wine they make on their own. So in this way, they earn their family living. Narine now is very worried since they are short of money and their son is going to get married and they must do some expenses connected with this wedding party.

Narine asks for a loan of 450,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy furniture for her son’s bedroom in order to make it nice and comfortable for his bride.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her son’s bedroom in order to make it nice and comfortable for his bride.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is a 26-year-old farmer from the village of Ratevani. Amiran lives with his wife, parents-in-law and five-year-old daughter. Amiran’s child and father-in-law have chronic health problems and get a small amount of assistance from the government. 

Amiran runs an agricultural business growing grapes, beans and potatoes on the family's land. Besides farming, he breeds one milk cow and a pig. The income from these agricultural activities is seasonal, so to earn monthly income, Amiran plans to start a business by opening a store where cell phones, headphones, speakers and other accessories will be sold. With the received loan amount, Amiran will buy stock of merchandise. 

Amiran will work as a salesperson himself and generate a monthly income. He will be able to cover the daily costs and improve the standard of living for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of merchandise and open a store where cell phones and accessories will be sold.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 40 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single. Her boyfriend is a driver, and they have three children between 12 and 23 years old; they are in school and live at home.
 
She has been selling pepper, onion, spices, etc. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend, and learned this way of selling from her sister. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, spices, onion, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, spices, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married, and they have five children between 2 and 12, all of whom live at home and attend school.
Esther has been involved in baking bread business for three years now. She enjoys selling to customers as it enables her to help her children. Her main challenge is fire heat.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour by the bag, eggs, oil, and sugar for her business. She would like to expand her business since she has more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more flour by the bag, eggs, oil, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en:
Gadir has been a taxi driver for 15 years; he is 40 years old. Gadir is married with two children. Gadir’s wife, Gulbeniz, is a housewife. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their motherland, Fuzuli city. Now they live in Musfigabag settlement in the Absheron region.

Gadir has applied for a loan in the amount of 450 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for pay for repairs to his car. Gadir hopes that after the repairs, his business and monthly income will be better. Gadir is thankful to Komak and Kiva organization for the aid. In the future, he wants to buy a new wheel and paint his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Dieu Seul Suffit Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU SEUL SUFFIT est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akossi Madeleine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 47 ans. Akossi Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Akossi Madeleine est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Julien. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Akossi Madeleine vit seule avec son enfant. Les charges du ménage sont assumées par Akossi Madeleine et son mari. Afin de faire face à ses responsabilités, Akossi Madeleine vend depuis vingt ans, de la nourriture (des beignets à base de farine de blé et des œufs) par le système de distribution. Akossi Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires, Akossi Madeleine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU SEUL SUFFIT, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group DIEU SEUL SUFFIT is composed of three persons who are friends living in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their businesses. The group's representative, Akossi Madeleine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 47 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Julien. The couple have one child, in school and in their care. Akossi Madeleine lives alone with her child. The household expenses are covered by her and her husband. 

To cope with her responsibilities, Akossi Madeleine has been selling food (beignets made from wheat flour and eggs) by the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales, Akossi Madeleine is requesting, along with the other members of the group DIEU SEUL SUFFIT, a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and eggs

loans.name: Adjeniya 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA 4 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom Raliatou Abèkê(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Raliatou Abèkê n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Raliatou Abèkê est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Akim. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Raliatou Abèkê vit seule avec ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Raliatou Abèkê et son mari. Pour ce faire, Raliatou Abèkê vend des savons et des pâtes dentifrices à son domicile depuis quinze ans. Raliatou Abèkê s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires Raliatou Abèkê sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA 4, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "ADJENIYA 4" is composed of three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Raliatou Abèkê (with her hand raised in the photo) is 37 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Akim. The couple have three children, not all in school, but all in their care. Raliatou Abèkê lives alone with her children.

The family expenses are covered by Raliatou Abèkê and her husband. To do so, she has been selling soaps and toothpaste out of her home for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and from Nigeria. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales, Raliatou Abèkê is requesting, along with the other members of the group ADJENIYA 4, a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste and soaps

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok is a resident from Prey Veng province. He is 47 years old and married with three children, all of whom are employed in various careers. Hok earns a living by raising seasonal rice crop on his own land. From the current business, he is able to make approximately KHR 10,700 per day, which he uses for daily food and other household expenses.

Currently, Hok’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so he wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this regard, he would like to acquire a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, which encouraged him to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of his family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene has a hotel in Kangundo town. She is 23 years old and single. She has been in the business for 4 years now, and it has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, milk, and rice for use in her hotel. This will enable her to serve more customers and also earn more income. She will use the anticipated profits to buy furniture for her hotel.

This is her first loan term. In the future, she hopes to buy her own piece of land.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, and rice.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has a fast food stall business in Tala town, which she has been running for the last 3 years. She sells snacks, soft drinks, french fries, and other foods. She is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with 2 children. 

She will use this loan to buy an oven for baking. She anticipates earning more income, which she will use to purchase other facilities for her business. She has paid all the previous loans successfully. She hopes to open her own bakery shop and also educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy an oven for baking.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 36 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married. They are blessed with three children, aged 11, 9 and 7.

Gilbert sells bread, a business he has been running for the last seven years. To enable him to buy more crates of bread to sell to his customers, he has applied for his second loan of 40,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

His current income per month is 30,000 KES and he plans to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to start a food kiosk for his spouse and to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd.

His hope and dream for his future business is to excel.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell to his customers

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong, 28, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one daughter and her husband. She and her husband earn money through their business of printing. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of papers and ink and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag.

loans.name: Saneed Group

texts.en: Saneed is a four–member female group from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. Sanida, a 36-year-old married woman, is the leader of the group. She completed her education up to the eighth class in Aden. Aden is one of the hottest cities in Yemen, so most of the residents wear summer clothes. Sanida has started selling women's summer clothes to her co-workers and neighbors, and has been doing this for two years. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy more clothes so as to expand her business. She hopes that she can use the profits she will make to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more clothes so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
BRIGITER, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still at school. She has several businesses. She runs a beauty salon and has a wholesale soft drinks business. She has been in these businesses for twelve years now. She works from 7.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be BRIGITER's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use for replacing missing items in the salon business and to increase the wholesale soft drinks business. She dreams of building her own house.

BRIGITER will share this loan with her loan group "UPENDO" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the the loan.

loans.use: to replace the missing items in the salon business and to increase on the wholesale soft drinks business.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz is 21 years old. He is a purposeful young man. He studies at the Medical University of Tajikistan. Parviz is studying the fourth course. He studies well. After lessons he works at night at the hospital as a nurse. In this way he earns his living, as his parents are poor people. He dreams that, after graduating from the university, he will be a good doctor able to treat all illness. Parviz is not married. He must to pay for his tuition at the Medical University for the fourth course but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan of 900 USD to pay his tuition. He is a kind young man, so it is good to support him.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 ce groupe au sein du banc villageois compte 26 femmes qui toutes s’activent dans des activités génératrices de revenu plus particulièrement le petit commerce et la transformation de produits. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent des liens de solidarité très développés. 

Madame Diénabou  (assise à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de  53 ans, mariée et mère de cinq  enfants dont 02 garçons et trois filles. Elle s’active dans la transformation de céréales : mil, maïs pour en faire du couscous et son destinés à la vente. De même elle fait de la transformation de bissap, gingembre et divers autres fruits suivant les saisons.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 10 sacs de mil à 5 000 Fr CFA le sac, 10 de maïs au même prix, un sac de feuille de bissap, 30 kilos de gingembre, 02 sacs de sucres 04 bassines, 12 tamis à 300 F r CFA pièce.

Les profits tirés de son activité l’aiderons continuer la construction de sa maison d’une part et d’autre part  soutenir son mari dans les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on July 12, 2008, this group within the 'banc villageois' is composed of 26 women who are all active in revenue-generating businesses, especially in small-scale commerce and producing food products. The women live in the same village and maintain ties of solidarity to a high degree.

Ms. Diénabou (sitting at the far left with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She is active in the processing of grains: millet and corn for making couscous to be sold. She also processes hibiscus, ginger, and a variety of other produce according to the season.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 10 sacks of millet at 5,000 francs CFA per sack; 10 of corn at the same price; a sack of hibiscus; 30 kg of ginger; 2 sacks of sugar; 4 basins; and 12 sieves at 300 francs each. 

The profits earned from her business will help her to continue building her house, and part of the profits will help her husband to cover the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase millet, corn, hibiscus, ginger, sugar, basins, and sieves

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 25 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Beatrice who is a business lady and they are blessed with one child aged 10 months.

Abel has been running his business of selling clothes for the past year. To enable him buy more stock of clothes, shoes and handbags to sell to his customers, he has applied for his first loan of 80,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is 30,000 KES and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd., and to buy more merchandise for his boutique shop.

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to prosper and to excel.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes, shoes and handbags to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old and is from Olkalou. He is married to Pauline and they are blessed with five children, ages 13, 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old.

Joseph is in the business of mixed farming, which he has been doing for the past six years. To enable him buy farm supplies like fertilizer, planting seeds and pesticides, he has applied for his fourth loan of 70,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is 30,000 KES, and his plan is to use profits realized from his expanded business to pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd., to educate his children and to buy some livestock.

In the future, he hopes to be an established farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like planting seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mahulome6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOME6 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et s'approvisionne au même endroit. La représentante du groupe nommée Hélène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Hélène n’a pas fréquentée l'école. Hélène est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Nassirou. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et un reste à leur charge. Hélène vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Hélène et son mari. Pour ce faire, Hélène vend divers articles (huile d'arachide) et des céréales (maïs, mil, riz) depuis douze ans dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Hélène ensemble avec les  autres membres du groupe MAHULOME6 sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHULOME6 group is comprised of three friends who get their supplies from the same place. The group representative named Hélène (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 35 years old. Hélène did not go to school. Helen is married to a driver named Nassirou. The couple has two children - one who goes to school and one who stays at home. Hélène lives with her husband and children. 

Hélène and her husband take care of the household expenses. In order to do this, Hélène has been selling various items (peanut oil) and cereals (corn, millet, rice) for 12 years in her region. With the goal of strengthening her business and satisfying the needs of her clients, Hélène and the other members of MAHULOME6 are asking for a sixth loan with ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: buy cereals (corn, millet, rice) and peanut oil.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 48 years old and married with two children. Winnie works very hard to provide for them.

Winnie runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Winnie has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, snack foods, shampoos, detergent soaps, etc. 

In the future, Winnie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush was born in Yerevan city. After school she entered the Yerevan State Linguistic University and she graduated in the department of English and German Languages. Soon after getting married she moved to Kapan city which is in Syunik region. Now she is a mother of three sons who are still school-aged. Her husband works in the military sphere. 

For thirteen years, Anush worked at the local school as a teacher of English Language and Literature, and she also gives paid courses of English Language and prepares pupils for entrance examinations. 
  
Anush is asking for a loan of 850,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some necessary literature which she needs for her courses with pupils at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some necessary literature which she needs for her courses at home with pupils.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives and works in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. He lives with his retired mother. He is divorced and his two children live with his ex-wife. Gagik, despite having a specialty as a lawyer, now he is a singer. He used to have a band and he went on tour to almost all the towns in Armenia and the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic. Now he mainly sings on weddings, birthdays and at corporate parties. 

He has dealt with Kiva before and now he needs a loan in order to record a new song, which as he says today is very popular and liked very much by his admirers. He thanks Kiva lenders very much since their support gives him a chance as a singer to become famous and popular as a singer.

Gagaik is asking for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to record a CD for which he has already prepared twelve nice songs.

loans.use: to record a CD for which he already has prepared twelve nice songs.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has four children who are still in school.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Maria Teresa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like rice, coconut milk, sugar, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years. Maria Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like rice, coconut milk, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ap

texts.en:
Ap, a 33-year-old married mother of two children, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a store selling soft drinks, fruit juice and coffee for five years. Ap started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

Ap is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase her turnover. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and reinvest in her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and coffee to sell at her store.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong is requesting a new loan to expand her store by buying a range of products including food and beverages, purchases that will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing both the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from Dasht village of Armavir region. She lives with her daughter and son. She works for the village local self governance body, and her daughter works in the village local library. They work hard to be able to earn a living. However, their salaries are so low that the family cannot afford a living based on those salaries alone. 

With the help of her family members, Tamara has a business cultivating beans, potatoes, cucumbers, beets, peaches, apricots, and apples. Her son assists her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming; he sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of  the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Tamara needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase potatoes and wheat seeds, to buy fertilizer, and to pay for harvesting services. She and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and wheat seeds, to buy fertilizer, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 37 years old and married with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income making wheel polishing equipment.

They started their business ten years ago. Nhung intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of raw materials to produce wheel polishing equipment to better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce wheel polishing equipment.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am, 38, is single and earns an income making clothing, national flags and face masks. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Am started her business eight years ago and is now requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a variety of cloth and sewing materials to increase her production and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Mevludi

texts.en:
Mevludi is a 64-year-old married man from the village of Chumlaki, East Georgia. He lives with his wife in his own house. Mevludi’s economic activity is a small-scale grocery store in his district where various food products are sold and there is a pharmacy. Mevludi works hard to run his business successfully but he still doesn’t have enough income to make savings and improve his standard of living.

He is very enthusiastic and has good business acumen. He has noticed a high demand for a dinner hall in his district. In response to the local market demand, he has requested credit to finance the costs of purchasing building materials and all the needed inventories for starting a dinner hall. He owns commercial space, and after renovation and furnishing, Mevludi will be able to host wedding parties, birthdays, etc. Local people will pay for using the hall and Mevludi will earn extra money.

He hopes this Kiva loan will be helpful for his family.

loans.use: to start up a dinner hall in his district.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the village of Velistsikhe. He is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife, two school-age children, and retired father. George and his father are builders and work on special projects. Moreover, George grows grapes in his own vineyard, and sells the harvest in the fall season.
 
In order to generate more income for his family's well-being, George plans to start another business with the Kiva loan. If his loan is financed, George will purchase vine saplings, grow them, and sell the small trees next year in the fall when there is a planting season. George thinks his project will raise his income and the family will get good profit for next fall.

George hopes that Kiva loan will be helpful for his business .

loans.use: to purchase vine saplings to grow and sell in the planting season.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, 30-year-old married woman from Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works as a driver and earns 400 Gel per month, the family's sole source of income.

Nana decided to start her own business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $900 to start a trading business. Nana plans to go to Turkey and purchase a stock of clothing there. She is very motivated and ready to tackle all of the difficulties associated with beginning a new business.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy  is married with two children and both of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She sells second hand clothes on a retail basis and has been in this business for 15 years. She works seven days a week.  

Prossy has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season), which hinders her movements and transportation, and thieves. She aspires to have permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells general items. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of items for resale, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and increase his sales and profits. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items for resale.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas María  Xisela tiene la edad de 32 años, casada, con cuatro hijos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años en su domicilio. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo está solicitado para compra de flete de leña, quintal de maíz, cal, molida. María del Carmen tiene 57 años su negocio es una pulpería  y un molino, Luz tiene 31 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en: This group consists of three hardworking partners. One is María Xisela who is 32 and married with four children. Her business is selling tortillas which she has done for 8 years from her home. She has been a customer of this institution for one year. She requests this loan for a load of firewood, a bushel of corn, and ground lime. María del Carmen is 57 years old and her business is a grocery store and a mill. Luz is 31 years old and her business is selling nacatamales.

loans.use: to purchase a load of firewood, a bushel of corn, lime, and others.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi's motorcycle transport business is doing well and he has successfully paid off his previous loan. He continues to support his parents and younger siblings.

Mwangi's proceeds have increased to a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He has been advanced a third loan of 40,000 KES, not to do business, but to furnish his house. This has been his desire for a while, and it will motivate him to work even harder so as to live a comfortable life. He is still in the transport business.

Mwangi plans to open a motorcycle spare parts shop in Narok town. His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to furnish his house.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 48 years old and is married. His wife is a small trader. He has been running a shop that fixes electrical appliances for 20 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and raise two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Luong is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more electrical equipment to repair and sell. He hopes that by offering more products he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more electrical equipment.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is 45 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver for hire. Dao has been running a business of making clothing for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Dao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more cloth and sewing materials in order to make more clothing. She hopes that she will be able to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Cam

texts.en: Cam, 46, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a soft-drink shop that they started 15 years ago. Cam is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of soft drinks to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of soft drinks for selling

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui, 55, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Mui started selling salt 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of salt to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is 50 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a driver for hire. Huong has been running a food stall in front of her door for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food ingredients and better quality food such as noodles and beef to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.
